review_body: The hotel was very nice although I had to change rooms once because of a strange smell from my original room. Turned out to be a blessing because the new room assigned to me faced the Tree Tower which was terrific.

We recently travelled to tokyo from New Zealand for a family holiday Myself my wife and 2 small children loved it. Tobu hotel levant is a stunning hotel with lovely helpful staff. Although the rooms are small which is pretty common for tokyo we had plenty of room for the four of us. The restaurant for breakfast was great and had a huge variety. We also frequented this restaurant for the buffet dinner and would highly recommend. 2 min walk to the trains and 30mins walk to the skytree. We will be returning to hotel tobu levant in the future for sure!

Excellent hotel. Large spacious reception area, beautifully decorated for Christmas! Well appointed bedrooms with en suite facilities. Extremely pleasing dining room with a good choice of food. The hotel is well situated for walking to places of interest and international restaurants and bars, although the roof top bar provides a relaxing place to enjoy a brilliant view of the city by night! A very good hotel l thoroughly recommend!

Very nice hotel in an excellent/convenient location. No hustle and bustle of fighting crowds. Especially like the convenience of airport limousine bus direct from either Haneda international or Narita airports at a reasonable rate.

10 min walk to subway station which connects to Disney with 1 change or to downtown on another line. Direct Disney bus shuttle available (the main reason for choosing this hotel) but unfortunately it was already fully booked upon check-in for the next day service. Airport bus stops at the hotel door. No major attraction nearby except the Skytree Tower. There are many small eateries, shops and launderettes around.Room is clean and decent sized compared to the average hotel in Tokyo. Firm bed which is good for problem backs but maybe a little too much for others. Keen service provided by the English speaking staff at reception.Disney bus aside there may be more hotel choices closer to the city and other attractions for the same price.

Excellent Hotel and Service. Staff were friendly, helpful and knew english as well. We arrived early so our room wasn't ready, but they let us store our bags, and then put them in our room before we returned which was nice. We had the non-sky tree view room which was still excellent. Wifi did play up a bit, but was overall pretty good. TV is Japanese, BUT it has the netflix app so you can sign in with your login if you have one. Breakfast is good but is mainly asian based, and limited english options, which gets a bit boring after a few days, but I would still get it included with the booking if I was to stay again. Hotel is about 7mins walk from two main train stations which is great! Shopping malls in the area are ok. There are a lot of eating options available in the area, ask the hotel staff for maps restaurants etc. There are no washing machines on site, but there's about 3 self service laundromat located closes by (wash and dry takes about 50mins). Walking distance to sky tree, then sky tree to Asakusa is walking distance again. I would definitely recommend and stay at this hotel again.

Stayed for three nights on the 11th floor. Room provided a great view of the Skytree which was certainly spectacular at night as its lights constantly changed colour. The room seemed to be different to the photo on the website and was much tighter with three beds than the photo suggest. Short walk to local JR and subway stations so easy to get in and out of Tokyo. Breakfast was pretty good with choice of western and local dishes. We booked Disney shuttle but as aour grandscon was not feeling well we missed morning departure and we did noy feel like waiting for 7:20 return piack up and used our JR passes instead. 7-11 store and lots of eating places nearby. Stff were very courteous as would be expected.

Stayed 8 nights. Almost two hour bus/limousine from Narita airport. Yes, it’s close to train station but far from everyplace you want to go with the exception of the sky tree tower. Seemed extremely far (even by train) from many sites you would not want to miss.Beds and pillows were rock hard, tiny and uncomfortable. Ceiling was paper thin and we heard noises from room above all night. Complained each night about what seemed like jumping or marching in room above-desk staff didn’t help and didn’t offer to move rooms. Lost sleep every night and was woken up every morning.No concierge on 5 of our days-not helpful if visiting from another country. No gift shop, very little common space to sit or meet.Room had four beds but only one tiny closet with two drawers- had to live out of suitcases and there wasn’t even room for them. The only good thing about this hotel was the view of the sky tree. I would not stay here again under any circumstances.

We stayed for 3 nights here and the hotel was very good. Huge rooms for Tokyo with very comfortable beds.The breakfast buffet was amazing, a great mix of local and Western food with lots of things to try.We had an amazing view from our room to Tokyo Skytree.My only complaint is that that concierge team were unable to get us a taxi to fit us and our luggage and we were very close to missing out train. They must know the size of the boot in the taxis but seemed shocked our luggage wouldn’t fit!But overall a great stay

Tobu Hotel has decent sized rooms. The reception and concierge staff are friendly and helpful. There are free shuttles to Tokyo Disney Resorts but you have to remember to book early. The Airport Limo from Haneda and Narita airports drops off here directly, which really adds to the convenience. Kinshicho metro station and JR station are about 5-10 minutes walk away. There are at least 3 good supermarkets within walking distance. I like the one at the basement of Arcakit building next to the hotel. There is a larger one at the basement of Parco mall. You can walk to Tokyo Skytree within 15-20 minutes. The hotel sells discounted tickets to go to the viewing gallery of Skytree, at better discount than at Skytree itself. Asakusa is also nearby. Ask for rooms with Skytree view.

I booked their budget twin room for 1 week which is a smaller room but was fine for the 2 of us as we travel light if you had more than 2 suitcases this might be a squeeze.The room was cleaned and had a kettle and fridge which was good for drinks.We did not have the Skytree view but from our room we could see Tokyo tower and the giant ferris wheel which was very nice at night when both of these were lit up.The handy (smart phone like device) provided was great for google maps and browsing on the go and lasted a full day on one charge there was the option to turn it into portable wifi so you can connect your phone but we did not use this but I think the charge was about 300-50 yen a day The bathroom was provided with all the essentials which was restocked every day ad had a bath with a shower over it.The breakfast was very busy at peak times but at around 6.30-7am it was much quieter and had various choices of food including a omelette station would recommend the curry which left us full for most of the day.We did not use any of the other facilities and forgot to book the Disney shuttle on time as it needs booking 48 hours in advance.Location was great as it was a few minutes walk to the station where several different lines run and got to almost everywhere we wanted using only 1 train. There was 2 shopping centres nearby including a great 100 yen shop and family mart was 20 second walk from the doors on the second floor.For location and price I would stay here again

We had a great stay at the hotel. The staff was very nice, very and very helpful. The location is great, the hotel is a short walking distance from the train station. The area is very nice, there are few shopping malls near by and lot of restaurants to choose from. The hotel was good but I felt it was little outdated, we got a room with 4 beds and for sure it was not as spacious as it looked on the pictures, it was small for a family of four. The room had a bad smell, like body odor and the beds were not that comfortable but we had a nice Skytree view and loved how it changed colors every night. The buffet was really good but by day four I got really tired of it, it was the same exact menu every day. It was really nice that they provided shuttle buses to Disneyland for free. Overall it was really good for the price and I would recommend it.

My family had the opportunity to stay at the Tobu Hotel for 6 nights recently. The accommodations were very nice, the staff welcoming, and the location was near a train station. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I've had for a reasonable price. They also have shuttles to Disney, as well as an airport shuttle. There's a multi-floor department store close by with a supermarket/drugstore in the basement level, as well as eateries on the top level. And of course, shops in between. Would definitely stay here again!

We stayed in a room that can accommodate 4 pax. Room surprising considered very big and clean with comfortable walking area ! About 5-8 mins walk to the main train station, shopping mall and convenient store beside the hotel. Situated in a quite and safe area which u will feel safe walking back at nite. Very convenient even thou is a bit far from the main city. Will come back and stay again.

We stayed for 8 nights and would definitely stay here again. They are a Disney Good Neighbor hotel so they have a free shuttle running to/from the parks (make sure to book ahead as it does have limited space). The hotel is also one of the drop off/pick up locations for the Airport Limo for both Narita and Haneda which makes it very convenient for flights. The room was perhaps small by Western standards but we barely spent any time in it so it was fine for us. Large bed! We didn't get a Sky Tree view but the view from our 21st floor room was great! 2 free waters are provided daily, as well as toothbrushes, hairbrushes, and other amenities.The staff was pleasant and efficient. The breakfast buffet is extensive, although we didn't have it included our room price. We ate there 3 times ($19 USD) because it was convenient but there's also quite a few coffee shops right down the street at the train/bus station which is about a 5 minute walk down the street. We would not hesitate to stay here again!

wet floors and dirty toilets . rude staff. staff lacks local knowledge. saggy beds. smelly carpets. not value for money. The handy phone in room is secretly listening and video recording everything . if u r a smoker, bad luck for you.

Located within a quick walk to a station made this hotel a very convenient stay. It is in a more quiet area so it is easy to relax after a long day of cramped trains and busy sidewalks. Our room had a stunning view of the skytree. The front desk was very helpful. I wish I had a way to take the shower gel they provided home with me! The robes in the room were very nice too.

I stayed here for 14 nights in October. A fantastic hotel - comfortable rooms, friendly staff and a great location.A short walk to the train station. Shopping centres are nearby. I didn’t pay for the breakfast at the hotel but there are three convenience stores very close by.The Disney resort shuttle bus was amazing and not having to get public transport to and from the parks was a big plus. Booking the shuttle was very easy either book on the hotel website or the staff can do it for you at the lobby.I definitely will be returning to this hotel

We flew in via Haneda airport and left via Narita. We travelled as a family of 6: 2 children and 4 adults. The hotel was convenient for us as it was a designated stop for both the Haneda and Narita limousine coach which meant door to door transfer of luggage. Tickets were easily reserved from the front desk. Furthermore the hotel provided free two way transfer to Disneyland and had ample eating options available at all times of the day. Location wise it was 5 min away from the nearby JR Train station which provided further convenience traveling to Shinjuku and Tokyo station for sight seeing without the need to change trains. Direct public bus from the train station took us to Asakusa area. We were fortunate to be allowed earlier checkin at 12noon. Mina-San served us and she was most helpful and kind. She patiently answered my queries always with a bright smile on her face. As we settled the paperwork she noticed I had 2 kids with me and provided them both with a kids amenity set each.The rooms (we got 2 twin rooms) were large for Tokyo and immaculately clean. There was a large bath tub which was more than sufficient for our children to enjoy bath time. On our checkout, we were fortunate to have Mina-San on duty. When she saw me rolling our luggages she immediately ran over to help us. As we chatted to the front counter, she promptly told her colleague about our limousine bus timing from memory and to hold our luggages till then without needing a request from us.A truly enjoyable stay made all the more memorable due to an exemplary staff.

Great staff . Housekeeping , bell staff and front desk are the best.! Thank you I wish I could leave tips in Japan because the service is amazing.close to station and lots of places to eat and shop.very clean hotel ! No laundry room is the only complaint.2 Wash and dry near by about 10 min walk.gazed at the sky tree every night it was beautiful.Will recommend to friends and family

The Tobu Levant is in a perfect location about 10 min walk to the trains and near 3 shopping centers and tons of great eateries. The staff are very helpful, friendly and kind. We booked a king size bed here(never had a king size bed in Tokyo before) the room is tokyo standard(tight for westerners, but with a king bed) and very clean the bed is comfy and the bathroom is small but serves it's purpose. The room comes with a desk, flat screen TV, fridge, free wifi and tea set for you to use. The closet isn't very big just enough space to hang a few things but there's a 2 drawer dresser to use also. I would definitely stay here again whenever I travel back to Tokyo. This hotel also has awesome views of sky tree(unfortunately our room faced the other way) but just walking around right infront of the hotel you can snap great pics of sky tree witch isn't far from the hotel.

Great location - close by to Kinshicho train stations, restaurants, convenience stores, laundromat, shopping and Tokyo Skytree. Big bonus is the aiport limousine bus stops/leaves from hotel so no lugging bulky luggage and transferring trains. Also they have a free shuttle bus (just make reservation) to and from Disneyland and Disney Sea - saves you money, time and great after long day with kids. Breakfast, served from 6:30 - 9:30, is fantastic - lots of asian and western choices (even soft serve ice cream and slushie machine) so book with room otherwise much more expensive to add on after (2500¥ per person). Room is spacious in Japanese standards. I booked 2 beds plus extra bed for 3 of us. Unfortunately the sofa bed was very uncomfortable - springs were popped up; basically needed another mattress topper. My kid ended up sharing bed because the bed was more like a full than a twin. The common spaces are really great (they host a lot of weddings and functions) but the room and hallway (17th floor) could use some updating. Overall would stay again - nice to come back to a somewhat quieter part of Tokyo after a long day of sightseeing - only 3 stops (10 min) to Akihabara, 20 min to Tokyo station, about 35 min to Shibuya and Shinjuku - times vary depending when you're taking train. We walked to Asakusa - about 45 minutes and Skytree - about 20 min. Hotel staff are very accommodating,friendly and polite.

My mom, sister and I stayed here in a standard twin room with extra bed for 6 nights. Hotel room is big, with closet and tables and chairs. Very convenient and accessible, only 5-10 mins walking distance to kinshicho stn. Only 1 train ride to/from Narita airport. There's also bus shuttle direct to/from Narita airport. Great location, lots of restaurant around the hotel, with a mall nearby. Free shuttle to/from Disney theme park.

The Tobu is a large hotel very close to Kinshicho station (3 stops east of Tokyo main station), very handy for getting around Tokyo but not smack in the middle of the touristy areas, which we liked. There is a department store KIT next door on way to the station with a really good supermarket in the basement and lots of nice restaurants on the top floor. The area has many restaurants and bars to choose from although not all have English or Picture menus. The hotel room was big for Japan with a great SkyTree view, we were given bottled water daily and the breakfast buffet had a great mix to cater for every nationality. The staff were very friendly. We would highly recommend.

This hotel deserved a high review. They are very considerate on your requests. We spent my husband's birthday and they had accomodated all my requests to surprise my husband. The hotel is clean and organized rooms are quite big as well considering we are a family of 5. I would say thumbs up. We really enjoyed our stay here. They are close to everything, restaurants around, convenient stores at the front of hotel, walking distance from the train station. They even have a money changer machine inside the hotel (sort of atm).They offered, unexpectedly a birthday cake for my husband which taste really nice.Well done Tobu.

We booked a family room which was entirely adequate for 2 adults, a 10 year old and an 8 year old. The hotel was super friendly and the constant stock of free bottled water was welcome. Beds were comfortable and aircon whisper quiet. The short walk to the JR station was just that....a 3 minute easy walk. We actually ended up eating at both the sushi train and the rough and ready looking ramen noodle place on the way to the station on two nights - both cheap and friendly and perfect for kids (TIP: the sushi chefs don't speak English - but the wait staff are great and a bit of laughing, polite pointing at menus and lots of 'arigato/thank- you' goes a long way in Japan. The kids loved it and the food was great. We spent 3 nights at the Tobu and wished that we'd returned for the final 3 day of our Japan holiday. Instead, we chose the more 'upmarket' Da-iichi Hotel in Ginza. To be honest, it was nothing flash, the rooms were smaller than the Tobu and it was more expensive (although to be fair it was only 2 stops away from Tokyo Station)

Fantastic area to be in. Amazingly clean and calm area, would have no problem being here as a solo traveller. The hotel itself is very well located, about 5 minutes maximum from the Kinshicho station. All the staff are incredibly polite and helpful. We used the concierge service to help us plan our stay and Ms Kojo could not have been more accommodating to the extent she made us an entire itinerary with prices, pictures and suggestions of things to do. This was perfect as it is our first time in Japan. My husband doesn’t give a full 5 star rating ever, but when I asked him what he would consider fair he had no hesitation!

Great location close to station, bus ,shops , plenty of food choices , coin laundry close . Great view of the sky tower from room buffet breakfast and dinner plenty of choices. Direct transfer from airport and to Disney world . Staff professionals and friendly rooms clean and comfortable big for Tokyo with a bath if you have small kids . We stay in two room cause we have teenagers did pay extra but was worth it No gym in site but there’s one close by at the Sumida city gym with a pool.

Stayed for eight nights. On main sobu line in from narita airport. Two mins walk to train and subway stations. There is also direct limousine bus access to hotel. In a lovely neighbourhood. Quieter than other mainstream areas in Tokyo but everything you need in terms of facilities and a great vibe about it. Easy 30 min access to everywhere in Tokyo. Hotel is excellent. Staff brilliant. We stayed in Skytree room- superb views to the tower and beyond at day and lit up at night. Room was great 28sqm- good size for Tokyo. All in all first class and they even organised luggage transport to next hotel for a small fee Circa 14stg a bag. Also 10pc discount of Skytree tickets.

We loved the hotel's amenities, and we were especially thankful that they replenished out stock of bottled drinking water every day. My son has fond memories enough about staying at this hotel that he wanted to bring home a bottle as a souvenir.

We had a lovely stay in Tobu, and got to explore different areas of Tokyo with the metro, train and bus, so we are grateful to have Kinshicho station nearby. There are a lot of restaurants and convenient stores in the neighborhood, so no problem in getting what we need. Breakfast is well spread with options. We just find he tea cups too small and had to go for refill a couple of times. Funny in Japan a country with tea culture l, there are not many hotel breakfasts that provide teapots.Rooms with the sky tree view is a bless, we love seeing it even though most of the time it’s top was in clouds.

Great accommodation in Japan. Location ideal for us as we had previously stayed in Shinjuku and wanted to stay in a different area. We used the buses and trains to get around, and found it easy to use the free Phone supplied to google which platforms etc to use. We also used their free bus to Disneyland and Disneysea, which was great, just prebook. It was lovely having the view of the Skytree. The staff were all helpful and friendly,we had no problems with the language barrier. Breakfast was well worth it and the staff always friendly, a special mention to the lovely Shinohara who made our day so special each morning. The Haneda limousine bus was great, unfortunately not available on arrival as we arrived too early in the morning. The rooms are clean and tidy, and well looked after. Close to many restaurants for dinner, supermarkets and shopping. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Thank you for a lovely stay.

まず英語が話せない、理解できないスタッフが多く、外国人相手に向かってヘラヘラ笑ってごまかそうとする。フロントはアルバイトかと疑ってしまうレベルの対応で、こちらは高額な宿泊費を支払っているにもかかわらず、その対価が得られない。こちらの言うことを無視して言い返してくる対応で、頭に来たのでさらにこちらが不満を申し上げると露骨に嫌な顔をされる始末。二度とお世話になりたくない、四つ星とはとても思えない最低サービスのホテル。The service of this hotel was quite bad for foreigners and they cannot understand English and didn't even try to listen properly. It is not worth to stay here for non-Japanese users.

We stayed for six nights as part of the 16 day Japan journey and I am glad we had Tobu as our introduction to Japan. After arriving in Haneda airport from US/Canada, it was a quick trip via the Airport Limousine Bus with a stop right at the front door of the hotel. This convenience can’t be overstated as after a long flight, you don’t want to have to navigate the hectic Tokyo subway transfers on arrival day. Especially if you are coming in during the rainy season like we did, you don’t want to worry about dragging your luggage in the rain. It is much better with the direct bus drop off.As some have complained, the rooms are not large by US/Canadian standards. But that’s expected for a large metropolitan city. We booked a quad room and it was a bit of work to move luggage around during the night/morning to get clothes for next day. Since we were seldom in the room as we spent most of the time exploring the city, the smaller sized room was not a big issue.The additional charge breakfast was a great value considered what you get. Be sure to add that as part of your online reservation with the booking web site. It’s considerably less expensive when breakfast is added as part of the room cost versus having to pay when you are there. For the people that complained in their review that the breakfast is repetitive, the answer is yes and no. There are changes daily but it’s subtle like types of fish changes or type of pastries may change after couple days. But there is enough variety to choose from even for a 6 night stay. You just need to leave the comfort zone of always have to eat the more western style breakfast. I picked between western and eastern style breakfast daily and had plenty to eat.To save money, we didn’t get the sky tree view rooms but you can just walk right outside of the hotel and take a picture down the street. The hotel has sky tree discount tickets that you can buy at the front desk to save few dollars off of the sky tree if you plan to go to the top. We just did a leisurely walk to the Sky tree on next morning after arrival just to get a feel of Tokyo street vibe. It’s a simple 25 minute walk.There are numerous restaurants just across the street as well as by the metro station 3 blocks away. If you buy the 24/48/72 hour Tokyo metro pass (sold at front desk as well as many Tourist offices), you can go to many places in Tokyo with the pass for a set price. The hotel is located on the east side (more historical side) so if you are more interested in Asakusa/Ueno/Tokyo station (for transfer to the Shinkansen), this hotel is in a great spot. Shibuya is 30 minute away on the Hanzomon line with no transfers. Shinjuku is 30 minutes away on the JR’s Chuo line so it’s not like you are hours away from the center but if you insist to stay next to the action places, then this place is not for you. For me, it’s good to stay in the quieter neighborhood after a hectic day of sightseeing and fighting the crowd.Lastly, I appreciate hotels that respond to my inquiries prior to arrival and I emailed Tobu many times prior to arrival and they were always prompt in their reply. They even left a note at the check in that I was interested in purchasing a 72 hour Tokyo pass as I had inquired about it previously in my email so that’s part of good customer service.Overall, this is a good value for your stay, especially if you have family of 4 as not too many Tokyo hotels have 4 beds in a room and with its location/breakfast/value for money, I would highly recommend Tobu for your Tokyo stay.

Hotel was a relief after long flight, as it had direct airport shuttle from Narita airport (about $25 per person but worth it). Check-in easy, room for 4 people was spacious, view of the city amazing, bathroom clean, shower pressure great, very complete bathroom amenities (shampoo, conditioner, bath/shower gel, toothbrush, toothpaste, etc...). Beds and bedding were firm and comfortable, room was well air conditioned for good sleep conditions. Concierge very knowledgeable and staff very helpful and spoke english. Helped with clear instructions to every site, activity, restaurant we wanted to visit. Next to Kinschicho station and super convenient mall next door which you can access by 2nd floor of the hotel. 7Eleven, Family Mart right in front of the hotel. 24hr coin laundry mat 1 block over. Walking distance to the Tokyo Skytree and surrounding neighborhoods are the Sumo wrestling area (Ryoguku), the anime area (Akihabara), old Tokyo (Asakasa). Hotel also has free shuttle service to Disney and Disneysea which was again very helpful. Distance to central Tokyo (Shibuya, Shinjuku areas) is about 30mins but easy with the transit system in Tokyo. Very enjoyable stay!

Located within a short walking distance to Kinshicho station and Arcakit mall. Staff was friendly and helpful when we interacted with them. Booked a 4 bed suite for me, wife, and 2 teens. Space was tight with all our luggage but we managed. Hotel provided Handy smartphone that can make free local and some international calls/wifi. For a small fee, phone can be unlocked for 24hrs to be used as a hotspot. Wish there was a microwave to use in room to heat up stuff as we would shop at the market in the basement of Arcakit for food items when we didn't want to go out to eat. There is a 24hr laundromat under the train bridge available nearby if you don't want to use the in house service.

We flew in overnight after long haul flight with aged parents over 70yrs old and I did request before arrival for early check in for obvious reason. Regardless how many times you explained the situation all they did was asking 50% additional for 2 hours early check in although the room was apparently available.Everywhere you go you don’t see this type of money craving mindset ...would never never recommend.

I guess for a hundred usd in Tokyo, this is what you will get... 500 Mt's from station and metro... Old hotel... Small rooms. Nice breakfast. Average... Just about OK to stay if on a budget. But not recommended... Travel time into City Centre is 30 to 45 mins 1 way.... Spend 150 and stay in the centre... I feel.... Did not take pics.... Enough to look up. Bhagwan.

We checked in at 10am once we arrived as the room was ready. This surprised us! We were so grateful as we can have a rest after long hours flight. The location is perfect as it’s only few minutes walk from the train station, convenient store across the street and a shopping mall nearby. Many restaurants inside the mall. The room is spacious for two adults, clean, equipped with a air purifier, a safety box, a hand phone and clothing spray. We enjoyed good WiFi connection in the room. Bath tub is big with good water pressure for shower. Very minimal noise from the train which did not affect our rest at all. Free shuttle bus available to Disneyland and Disneysea daily. The bus driver is punctual. Staff are helpful, hardworking and friendly. They helped to keep our luggage after check out too. We enjoyed our 6 nights stay and would definitely recommend to our friends and family.

The staff were very welcoming and helpful. Good lication, 5 min walk to Kinshichō train station, and 4 conbinis nearby. They also have free bus shuttles to Disneyland and Disneysea and a few airport limousine bus lines a day to and from the hote (about 2000 yen). Room was quite big and pretty, very clean and with a beautiful view of the city. Wonderful!

Very comfortable hotel, although our room was a bit small and cramped. However it was well equipped, even a smart phone for your own personal use.Reasonably short walk through the park, which is almost opposite the hotel, to the Sky Tree. Very close to the railway station. Breakfast was very good, especially liked the 'do it yourself' fresh orange maker. Plenty of choice to suit all nationalities. Shopping mall almost next to the hotel, with eating outlets on the 10th floor.Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Great Hotel in a good location for train travel and sightseeing Easy walk to the Tokyo Tower. Good service from hotel Staff Plenty of small eating places around the Hotel..Interesting area.Hotel provided free of charge a direction finder which was invaluable for moving around Tokyo

My daughter was sure we were at the wrong hotel since it was on a few minutes walk to the Kinshichō Station (Sobu Line - Rapid). Since it's so close to the station, it's easy to get around to many locations in Tokyo. It's about 20 minutes walk to the Sky Tree. There are a lot of stores, eating establishments, and convenience stores nearby.The rooms are nice with AC and dehumidifiers. The rooms and bathroom were designed with foreign visitors in mind. We got two complimentary bottles of water daily. The buffet breakfast has something for everyone; the food was tasty. The downstairs coffee shop had the best shave ice...the water in imported from Nikko (according to my Japanese friend, Nikko has the best water.). It HUGE and fluffy. You have to eat it relatively quickly before it starts melting.I will definitely keep this hotel on my list for return trips to Tokyo.

We spent four nights at this hotel and have no complaints. The staff was very friendly. We stayed at 6 different hotels during our two week trip to Japan and S. Korea and this was the only hotel in Japan that did not allow us to store our luggage with them upon checkout. The other hotels did allow this so that we only had to take backpacks to some of our overnight stays in other locations. The subway station was only a block away so getting anywhere from here was very convenient. The 10 story mall next door had a lot of restaurant choices on the 10th floor but there were a lot of other restaurant choices nearby as well. The hotel breakfast buffet was a bit pricey but considering the vast number of choices of what to eat and quantities of food, there would be a good value if a big breakfast is your thing. The room was small by US standards but adequate by Japanese standards. We could actually walk completely around the bed (narrowly) which we can't say for many of the hotels in Japan. The facility was very clean

Upon arriving at this hotel, the staff greeted us so warmly and check in was so efficient. It was lovely to be able to get to ones room quickly and to be able to freshen up for an evening of exploring. The hotel is situated in Old Town of Tokyo and I was worried that my husband and I were staying in the wrong part of town but we were not disappointed. The train station is an easy 5 minute walk away as well as shops being close by and plenty of food outlets to choose from to eat at. Convenience stores were close by too.The Sky Tree Tower looks closer than what it is - it is a 25 minute leisurely stroll away from the hotel. It too offers plenty of shopping and eating outlets.This hotel is quite large and our room faced onto the railway tracks, proving to be quite noisy especially at night but we got use to them - last train at midnight, first train at 5am. The size of our room was good and the amenities were very good.We were given 2 bottles of complimentary water each day, we had free wi-fi in our room and the bonus of being given a smart phone proved to be very valuable. Not once did we get lost travelling around Tokyo with the hotels smart phone - a big tick by us.The hotel also offered a beautiful buffet breakfast on level one each morning with a good selection of food. One morning it was quite busy due to a tour group but the hotel set up one of their conferences room as an overflow, which proved very helpful.The hotel has a lovely lobby with a special area for group check-ins. In the middle of the ground floor is a lovely cafe that provides music/entertainment at certain times - it was very pleasant having a coffee plus a cake after exploring Tokyo all day, although it wasn't cheap.The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle bus to Disneyland/DisneySea a few times a day (see the schedule) - it must be booked as soon as possible. The ride on the coach there and back was lovely.The hotel will also book any hotel to airport coach transfer on your behalf; we really appreciated this service as we expected to be lugging luggage on the trains to the airport. The cost for this transport was not too bad - we did make two other stops on the way to the airport.The hotel was very clean, modern, great large lifts, good quality towels, etc and extremely efficient staff whom seemed to love their jobs.My husband and I look forward to returning.

Could not recommend staying here enough! Clean, quiet, great service, discount for the sky tree and close to transport. I travel regularly for work and this is the best 4 star hotel I have been to in years!

We stayed one week in this hotel during our stay in Tokyo. The hotel is conveniently located near Kinshicho station (for both JR Line and metro). It's one of the few hotels in Tokyo we found that accepted children and offered enough space in the room to stay together. The free shuttle bus to Disneyland is a nice bonus. The breakfast buffet offered many options, Japanese and Western. Cleaning was spotless and the staff very helpful. I will definitely stay here again when visiting Tokyo next time.

I researched different Tokyo hotels, finally decided on Tobu Hotel Levant.Very glad Idid, stayed 5 nites with my teenage sons. Location, Cleanliness,, close to Eateries, Train station, Mall, and Laundromat ticked all the boxes.Breakfast good selection with the added Bonus of a DIY freshly squeezed Orange juice machine.Plentiful supply of hot water, very strong pressure,and a bathtub too, which my Son's enjoyed.Very well maintained Hotel, room very spacious.The staff although difficult to communicate in english, put in the effort, all requests met. The helped me with the Airport bus to Haneda Airport,(Pick up from Hotel), and Disney Sea Shuttle Bus, also pick up from Hotel.I intend to visit Tokyo again, next time staying longer and will stay at Tobu Hotel Levant again.This is the first visit for all of us to Tokyo,Our purpose was to go to China first, the airline allowed us to have a stop over in Tokyo. Great visit, Excellent choice of Hotel!

We (2 adults and 2 kids) had a very clean and spacious room, considering the Japanese standards. The hotel is located close to metro station, from where you can easily reach any part of Tokyo. The room had a great view of Sky Tree tower. The staff is very helpful and kind. Recommended.

Stayed for 3 nights with my husband and teenage sons (17 and 13). Check in was smooth and friendly (we had paid for early check in and that was expensive) and our room was clean and comfortable with great views of the city (20th floor). We had a quadruple room, 4 single beds in a line which was cosy (!) but there was just space enough for our suitcases etc. In other hotels in other cities we visited the “single” beds were larger divan size which on reflection was better and I would look for in Tokyo next time. The shower was very good (over a bath), good selection of free toiletries and good towels! The breakfast buffet was expensive but according to my husband and youngest son was very good. Make sure you collect your breakfast discount tokens when you check in. The restaurant on the top floor had even better views, we had a set menu available only to hotel guests which featured “Wagu” steak and it was delicious, if a bit pricey (6800 yen each, including one nonalcoholic drink).

This hotel was amazing. It's probably one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at, if not the best. It's a lot bigger than I thought it would be. It's also in a busier neighbhood (in a good way) than I thought it would be. I stayed here for 4 nights towards the end of March.Pros:-Views - we paid around $15 USD extra per night so that we could get a room with a view. Let me tell you, this is probably the best $60 I've ever spent because the views do not disappoint. The Skytree is dead center of your window. It's nice to have something to look at when the jetlag hits and you're up at all sorts of crazy hours-Toiletries - little toiletries were refilled everyday, like toothbrushes, combs, razors, body scrubbers, and slippers. They even have Shiseido hair/body products in the shower-They had this fabric spray/sanitizer which worked wonders on my clothing. It refreshed it and even got out the wrinkles, so I was able to save myself from ironing anything-Smart phone - you can use the smart phone during your stay, which gives you internet and you can bring it out. So it comes in handy if you didn't get a pocket wifi. There's also free local/room to room calls so if you're traveling with someone staying in the hotel, have them bring their phone out too and you'll be able to reach them-Breakfast - this is an additional 20 USD, but you should treat yourself to the breakfast at least once. It's a Japanese breakfast buffet, so they have a little bit of everything: omelette station, rice, curry, noodles, soup, fruits, even a soda machine with about 10 different Japanese sodas. And these are only about a third of the available items-Water - two free water bottles each day-Shower pressure was great-5 minute walk to the train (Hanzomon Line/Sobu Line) - getting everywhere was super convenient. This neighborhood is a good jumping point if you want to explore other neighborhoods. Shinjuku is about a half hour away; so is Ginza-Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. There's a Daiso that's a 5-minute walk away. 7-Eleven and Lawson's is right across the street. There's a supermarket 5 minutes away if you want to buy Japanese snacks/food products to bring home-They have a Yamato service counter in the lobby from 8 AM to 12 PM, so you can drop your luggage off right in the lobby, and they'll arrange to send it to your next destination. It's nice to not have to drag your suitcase around, especially on the ShinkansenCons-Rooms are a bit small, but I feel this is standard to Japan. I've probably been spoiled with large American hotel rooms-Bathroom doors open outward, which is a bit weird but I guess it makes sense since the bathroom is also small-Because the rooms are small, windows in the room can get steamy if you take a hot shower because there's really nowhere for the steam to escapeAs you can see, the list of pros is a long one, and the list of cons aren't really anything serious. I would love to stay here again the next time in Tokyo. However, I think I would want to stay in a different neighborhood - not because I didn't like this one, but more so because I would want to get a feel of what other areas of Tokyo are like.

review_body: There are a lot of reasons why we liked this hotel. We recently stayed here while traveling with our daughter and her friend. It was a college graduation trip for them. First, the price was within our budget and the hotel had a decent upscale feel - (similar to a Marriott, Sheraton, Westin). Although we were not close to the heart of Tokyo, we were around the corner from the Kinshicho station which was so easy to travel to anywhere we wanted to go. So, the value in this hotel was the quality for the price, location close to a major station, free shuttle to Disneyland/Disneysea, free rental of Handy phone for maps, etc., 2 bottles of water provided each day. All these things add up to significant savings especially when you have more than one room. Overall, I asked my daughter and her friend if they would stay here again if they returned to Tokyo and they said definitely. They liked the upscale feel of the hotel and proximity to the train station.

I don't really understand how this place is rated so highly. I stayed 2 nights and things were really just average. The location is pretty good. Overall I wouldn't say Kinshicho is the most convenient neighborhood in Tokyo to be based in, but the hotel is less than a 10 minute walk to both Kinshicho train and metro stations, which was convenient. Nearby are plenty of convenience stores and restaurants. Like some other reviewers noted, there is some adults only nightlife in the evenings in this neighborhood, but it isn't visible in the immediate vicinity and it doesn't feel unsafe next to the hotel. Checking-in was quick and pleasant. They seem accustomed to English-speakers and other foreign guests. The lobby interior was bright and pleasant. My room had 2 twin beds and it was about average in size for this type of hotel in Japan. Everything seemed clean. The free wifi seemed adequate. The TV was ok, 2 English language channels. The AC/heater was easy to use. I appreciated the 2 free bottles of water a day. The "Handy" brand free smartphone was useful, even though the user interface is quite clunky and sometimes laggy. The free coffee didn't taste very good, and finding a place to plug-in the big water heater was actually a bit difficult. Not a big issue however.The bathroom was somewhat of a good surprise. Although the toilet is slightly too close to the sink, the overall size of the bathroom is slightly above average compared to other Tokyo hotels. And the bathtub is a decent size. I really appreciated that this bathroom actually has some space for your toiletries next to the sink. I just wish that they provided hand lotion. The shampoo and body wash/gel seemed pretty good.Unfortunately, 2 big problems ruined the stay for me. First, the bed was quite hard and my back was actually aching a bit when I woke up everyday. Also, there were 2 types of pillows offered, but I didn't notice much of a difference. They were both too hard and somewhat uncomfortable. The 2nd big problem was the fact that my room faced multiple train tracks, so it was super loud about every 10 minutes as the trains passed by, sometimes multiple ones simultaneously. The first time that I heard it, I actually thought that it was a monsoon storm pouring down torrential rain, which was not the case. This quickly got old and stressful. I called the front desk and complained about the noise. I asked to move to another room, but they claimed that they were all full. Perhaps this was true, but I was very dissatisfied that they could not offer another solution. If you come here, you should definitely bring earplugs, and even then, it may not be enough. At least checking out on the last day was very easy. Overall, the Tobu wasn't that bad, but given the 2 major issues, I would not come back again. If you're a light sleeper or have back problems, you should avoid this place.

Wonderful hotel very clean. Located next to train station and mall. Awesome breakfast plus a lot of little extras in the room like bottle water ,toothpaste ,toothbrush ,robes .slippers. The room was a little small but after all this is Tokyo I wasn’t expecting anything as big as we will get in State. Front desk was very helpful but did not speak much English so was very difficult to communicate with most of the employees.

The hotel is old and nothing special, but you'll get a large clean room for cheap. Location is a bit off center but still very convenient to get around. If you're a mid-low budget traveler, it's a perfectly good hotel.

We stayed two separate time at this hotel and we found it to be clean, good room size with the view of the Tokyo Sky Tree and all necessary amenities and comfortable beds. They provide a smart phone free of charge which we found to extremely helpful and we even made call back to the US. The breakfast buffet has a large spread with both western and Japanese food and their diner buffet isn't bad either. We were however, somewhat disappointed at their Sky view restaurant, they don't speak English and consequently not able to answer questions about any menu items and their food should be better for the price that they charged.

I have some friends who travel regularly on business to Tokyo and they always stay at this hotel. We stayed there for five days on the front end of our recent visit, and for four days on the back end. What a great find!There is a shuttle bus that runs from Tokyo Airport directly to the hotel which makes your travel quite easy. But we took the local train and it cost much, much less. Plus, we didn't have to wait for the bus. Ask for help finding the right train which leaves directly from the airport and you will find this is by far the best way to get to the hotel. The hotel is only a block from the Kinschicho Train station which provides easy access to the entire Japanese train system, including Tokyo Station where you can catch the bullet trains. And there is a Starbucks and a WI-Fi cafe in the station.The Tobu Levant is a luxury style hotel without the luxury price. In fact, they have all sorts of different levels of rooms at various prices, from economy to luxury. We settled on a standard double facing the Sky Tree Tower and the price was significantly cheaper than every other place we looked at around the sprawling city.The rooms are typical of Japanese hotels and quite small. But they are clean and attractive with all the amenities, including a free cellphone that you can use during your stay. And many of the views from this high rise hotel are quite stunning.The hotel staff is gracious, friendly, knowledgeable, and they treat everyone like royalty. The hotel itself looks like a luxury hotel in every respect, including the doormen.The hotel is located on the east end of town near the Sky Tree Tower, one of Tokyo's most prolific buildings. There are many restaurants all around the hotel, including a 24-hour automated place for when the jet lag kicks in and you are wide awake in the middle of the night during your first few days. and there is a 7-11 and a Lawsons within sight of the hotel where you can buy beer, wine, liquor, and great takeout.The hotel is located in the Sumida part of town which is comprised of quiet neighborhoods, so it's a great place to relax after a busy day of sightseeing. There are shopping malls around the hotel and at the Sky Tree Tower complex which is within easy walking distance. There are game arcades and bike rental shops across from the hotel. And there is a large urban park (Sarue Onshi) three blocks away where you can stroll through lovely gardens. And two blocks in the other direction there is an amazing greenway lined with ponds and waterfalls that runs all the way to Sky Tree. The hotel has a very nice atrium dining room and most evenings there is musical entertainment. And the hotel is connected directly to a shopping mall filled with stores and some great restaurants. If you want to escape the hustle and bustle of Tokyo; spend time in a lovely Japanese residential area; and have access to a huge range of attractions, museums, transportation, shopping, and eateries, without paying a lot of money, the Tobu Levant is an excellent place to stay during your visit to Tokyo.For more travel tips, please check out my popular travel blog.

We stayed a few nights and had 4 single beds for our family. Was perfect as everyone had their own space. The food st breakfast was wonderful. Fantastic selection. I could have Japanese style and the rest of the family traditional western breakfast with the teen even sneaking the icecream for breakfast!! The hotel was beautiful and location was great. We will definitely be staying again on our next trip.

review_body: Stayed here, booked 2 rooms - one for my parents and one for myself, my wife and baby.The staff was very warm and friendly , never had any issues at all.Each room includes a handy phone (free data, free local calls and room to room when out and about - incredibly convenient) and a smart tv - you can log into your streaming services .Next time, I'll do my best to rebook here.

We booked a quad room with four single beds and breakfast. The room had so much space for four persons, with our luggage open. We still had ample space to walk inside the room. The bathroom was quite large as well, for Japanese standards. We had a great view of the Tokyo Skytree, albeit days wherein fog was covering the structure. There were many choices from the breakfast buffet spread.I heard the property was in the red light district (or was it formerly one?) but we felt safe walking around the neighbourhood, even if we were 4 women. There were convenience stores around and many restaurants and a shopping area nearby as well.The Kinsicho Station is just two blocks away, providing easy access to go around the city. We took the Keihin Kyuko airport bus to Kinsicho and just had to walk to the hotel. We got our airport bus tickets conveniently from the front desk on the day of our departure for Haneda Airport.Will definitely recommend this hotel, especially for bigger groups and families. The hotel provides a shuttle service to Tokyo Disneyland (we didn't avail of this).

My family (me, my wife and 2 boys) stayed 8 nights at the hotel. Upon arrival, we were told that my 7 year old child has to pay the full price equivalent that of 1 single room for the next 8 nights even if he is sleeping with us without an extra bed - no negotiation. This was very upsetting because in Expedia, it clearly showed that the room can accommodate up to the 2 adults and 2 children. We also paid for a twin room with an additional sofa bed (total 3 beds).Fortunately we contacted Expedia through a relative in Singapore and very quickly, Expedia contacted them and we were allowed to be charged for the price of an extra bed instead. We have to accept since it is a "more reasonable" rate. However, our room was not changed and there were no additional bed in the room.Having started on a sour note from an overnight flight, we put that behind us and decided that it should be a great holiday.Tobu Hotel on general is situated in a very good location - one word - CONVENIENT. There were amenities, eateries, a number of supermarkets, and most importantly, connected to JR station and Tokyo subway. This helped planning travels and visiting attractions a lot easier.The Hotel is old but clean. The rooms are big for Japan standard, each bed is bigger than a twin but smaller than queen, good sized toilets with bath tubs and easy to control shower. Provided generous supplies of toiletries, towels, hangers etc. The sofa bed was initially very thin and hard, we got the housekeeping to add a layer of mattress over it and it was fine after first night. Provided a mobile device in each room for guests' navigation, though we did have our own data card. Unfortunately WIFI was not fantastic, weak or no signal when many guests are hooked on. They can't do anything about it. We had missed packing our power adapters and they were able to help us with that.Breakfast had a good spread but as all other comments you read here, served the same every other single day. On a day we could not make it for breakfast, they packed some juice and croissants for us to take on our journey.They had free Disneyland/Sea shuttle buses to take you to/fro. However, very important to reserve your seats and make sure your name is on the list. They were so strict with all these paperwork!In summary, our family enjoyed ourselves tremendously in Tokyo. Well, partly, the location and comfort of the hotel played a part.

Perfect place to stay. We arrived around the evening time. As we stepped into the hotel with luggages. There is already a staff approaching to us and ask are we checking in? Great service and observations. She leads us to the front desk and after that she explains to us where's our room and what is nearby in English. In fact very fluent English. I would like to Thank You the conceige desk agent **Natsumi KohJoh** Excellent Customer service. Even though I won't get this service from a 5 star hotel, maybe a bellboy will approach to you. Location for this hotel is Great. Only a few minutes from the JR line or the metro line. North side of JR line. Shopping mall. Supermarket. Daiso the whole floor just right beside us. Food court on the 10th floor.. Lots of choices and reasonable price. And they closed around 10pm. Also you got 7 eleven. Lawson and family mart.. For breakfast. There is Starbuck. Excelsior Cafe and Tully coffee. We have booked a Skytree view on 20th floor. Nice view. We stay in this hotel for 7 days. But we are not able to see the green color for the Skytree. We did see the blue purple and brown color. Room is very spacious and really like they do have a floor lamp underneath the cabinet which makes it more easier to go to the washroom at night. They also come with a bottle of spray freshener or Odour free which you can spray on your clothing or jacket especially when you finished BBQ or heavy smell food. They also comes with a fridge and safe. The shower is very strong. And the mattress is quite okay firm. But is almost time to change before the Olympic starts next year. Ice machine is located near the elevator. And there is vending machine and tobacco vending machine on the ground floor. Basically you got everything you need for staying in this hotel. Plus most of the staffs do make eye contact and greet you every time when you pass by them. Next time when I go to Japan. Definitely I will stay here again unless they don't have any rooms left.

Located just by the Kinshicho station making travelling around Tokyo easy. The staff were very pleasant and helpful with good English.Handy coffee shops towards the station if not having breakfast in the hotel. One side is next to the railway but with good insulation the train noise was barely audible in the room. Free mobile phone is very handy. It could be said that the room was a little tired but was always immaculately clean and large compared to some Tokyo rooms. This was the first time I had stayed at this hotel and would not hesitate to stay again.

Location may not be the greatest, but it's within walkable distance to the subway and JR station. We have walked about 30 minutes to the Tokyo Skytree and I thought it was a very enjoyable walk, you can to experience the Japanese lifestyle without being crowded like in Shibuya or Shijunku. From Haneda airport, there's also an airport shuttle you can take which drop you right in front of the hotel, so you don't have to hassle around the subway / JR with your luggages. Rooms are very decent in size, bigger than lots other Japanese hotel. There are 24 hours restaurants and convenient stores right across the hotel so if you are jet-lag and wake up in the middle of the night, you won't be starved. The hotel also has a shuttle to the Tokyo Disneyland. Staff are so nice and helpful, like alot of other Japanese, they may not be perfectly fluently in English but they sure did try. My mom speaks decent Japanese so we had no issues communicating with the staff and when asking for help. They surly tried to help even when they heard me speaking to my mom in English asking different questions and comments.Also, the hotel breakfast buffet is a MUST to try. It offers whole range of varieties and they even have a self-serve orange juice machine. It's about 30CAD but I found it worth every single penny. Even it's not located centrally in the tourisy area, but I think I will return to the same hotel next time when I visit Tokyo.

A hair dryer was not working last year. A refrigerator was out of service this month and they replaced the other one after request but we could not use it because of the nasty smell and dirty condition. They have so much high rate for the weekend (25000). They always copy your passport on every single booking day. They only live because of the skytree view. No one can speak English when I ckeck out. Sorry.. skytree is not interested in to me any more. You can see it everywhere. Find out other hotels..

We, a family of two adults and 2 teenage children stayed here for 3 nights From check-in assistance with keeping our luggage till the room was ready to guidance with local services and directions we were well looked after. The sky tree view room and breakfast buffet exceeded expectations. What made it special was the personal support given by Guest Service officer Yumi Tazaki in arranging local train tickets, transfers to Disneyland and even working past her shift end to help with filling in the forms to get 3 pieces of luggage sent to our hotel in Osaka. Yumi's pleasant manners and attention to detail made her and the hotel shine. Will definitely come back. Great Job.

Unfortunately we left booking a hotel a little late for the christmas period, so based on the majority of reviews we went with this hotel even though the price was a bit high. It was a bit dissapointing as the staff were friendly enough but offering information on local things to do and see was non existent. And lack of english speaking staff was a bit of a challenge at times. Plenty of choices for breakfast, room was a good size and view of skytree was fantastic. Pillows are shocking, small and hard. The lifts sometimes smelled terrible from people coming from the smoking room. Wouldn't stay here again at the price we paid

The hotel is near station, lucky me that our view room was facing Sky Tree. Room was clean we have 4 bed in one room, comfortable. Amenity was complete, our kids got " special " slipper and brush teeth. There was Limousine bus from the hotel direct to Airport, convenience if you brings lots suitcase.

Large older hotel in nice area, but staff was not friendly, breakfast was too expensive and room was just average. Room was too hot with sun blaring in throught the window and thermostat did not work. When we asked for another room, they refused and told us all rooms were booked when we knew they were not. Much better hotels such as Dormy Inns.

It was my second stay at this hotel. Had a good impression after my first stay last December and it was no different this time. The staff are welcoming and very accommodating. It was very comforting to know that several members of the staff speak English. I was pleasantly surprised when their concierge, Ms Natsumi Kohjoh was assisting us with our departure arrangements. As we were departing Japan from Narita airport, she took time to explain to us the different alternatives we had from taxis to bus and train routes. Even when we had to change our requested time for the bus while she was on the line with the bus company, she patiently accommodated our request and translated the information seamlessly. As she was unable to get through to the taxi company during the time of consultation, she promised that she would assist with the task while we went out for our dinner. She wanted us to enjoy our last evening in Japan for this trip. Upon return, I learnt that she had left a hand written note for us after we left informing us of the arrangements she had made for us. It was with her patience and arrangement that we were able to rest at night knowing we’d be able to catch our flight the next day.My family and I are very grateful for her assistance and for the hospitality displayed by the staff at the hotel. I would definitely consider Tobu Levant Tokyo when I visit Tokyo in the future.

We visit this hotel twice during our trip to Japan. Really nice hotel with good facilities near Metro and JR station. This is very useful if you have JR pass. You can walk to SkyTree around 10-15 minand after it going to Asakusa Temple, where are you can find big souvenirs market. Rooms is quit big with tea/coffee maker, 2 bottles of water wil be offered each day. Breakfast is perfect, it include western style dishes and asian corner. You can take a soft icecream if you want.

Quick and easy check-in. Very friendly receptionist, Yoda A. San. Very impressedAt this price,the room is bigger than every room I have been in Japan.The bathroom has a large tub. Not bent legs easily adjustable temperature. Shiseido shampoo Bathe the hair and soft and comfortable. The glass of the water has been dismissed. Well, until a little detail.There are many pillows. Both soft and hard. Choose one5 power outlets enough for charging phone and camera but little loose.New slippers change every day. The towel is very soft and fragrant.Fabric deodorant spray in the wardrobe.Opposite the hotel is a convenience store, including a 7-Eleven Lawson, Family mart. 24-hour restaurant. Traveling is very convenient. The hotel is close to the bus station, The JR train and metro. Have a free ride to Disneyland.Air Port shuttle bus stop at the hotel. Next to JR station is underground station. 24 hours Snacks and souvenirs can be found here. One disappointment is that every day the breakfast does not change at all. Mostly Japanese breakfast. The hotel served us very well during our recent 8-day trip in Tokyo. We liked the fact that there was complimentary good neighbour shuttle bus service to go to Disneyland/sea theme parks from the hotel. It is recommended to book in advance though in case the bus is full. I booked it online before the trip. Very convenient! It is also a stone’s throw away from Kinshichō station which makes public transport easily accessible. We took the train on some days. Beside the train is a shopping mall which you can find almost everything you need in it like a supermarket, drug store, Uniqlo, Daiso, kids departmental store, food etc. McDonald’s and Starbucks are also available there if you crave for some non Japanese food. We also tried some eateries opposite the hotel. You can find ramen, bbq food, Japanese bentos, 7-11 etc there. Burger King and Yoshinoya are along the same street too. Spoilt for food choices. You can also book a limousine bus to/fro airports or choose to take JR line to hotel if your luggage is manageable. The hotel is also very clean. We will definitely stay at this hotel again !

Set up base here and travelled throughout various parts of Tokyo over 7days. Clean & good sized room that can cater to 3pax/room comfortably. 3min walk to JR/Metro Stations. Cross a road to access 7-11 & Lawson. Basic shopping needs are well catered to in the shopping malls around the area. Additional plus point.. you can take a leisure 20min stroll (with luggages!) to Oshiage Station (Sky Tower) to take the KS Narita Skyaccess to Narita Airport. Reasonable convenience given the taxi costs and complexity of navigating the rail system. Recommended !

From the moment, my family and I stepped in till the time we left; everyone from Tobu Levant have been providing outstanding customer services! It is amazing how they will go above and beyond to help you in any queries you may have e.g. where is the nearest eye doctor. On the same example, they will help you to make appointment and print out map to show how you can reach your clinic. What can you say but just," Wow". The conditioning of the hotel may not be the best I have personally seen but I must say the cleanliness of the place is no different from those from 5 stars hotel! Considering their tenure in the hotel industry, I must say they are top of their class to be able to maintain such high standard.Like every establishment there are rooms to grow. I would love to see them change their breakfast buffet menu. For those who only had it only once, you will be happy with their varieties. To have to eat 9 days of breakfast with the same menu is not a pleasant experience. The other suggestion that I like to make is to request the hotel to provide portable vaccum cleaner. This is extremely useful for travelers who uses vaccum bag to pack their clothes to make sure there are space for buying more things in their luggage! I am sure you can understand that also helps Japan to strengthen their economy right?All in all, this hotel is still A with a distinction for me! Well done, Tobu Levant

clean rooms and good-sized for Tokyo. Near Tokyo sky tree and easy access to Narita airport via direct local train (not Narita express). Less than 5 minute walk from train. Hotel is also on Narita bus line (luxury coach) but service more limited. Staff was very nice and provide good restaurant recommendations.

What can I say? The Tobu Hotel is absolutely amazing - from the excellent email communication two months prior to visiting (I requested a cot and a room in one of the upper floors - we were provided with both) to the overwhelmingly friendly check-in, to the spotlessly cleaned room with an amazing view of the Tokyo Skytree, to the brilliant location. A 7-eleven and Lawson stores are located across the street which makes stocking up on essentials easy as pie. There are plenty of eateries and bars in the area (particularly around the back streets) and Kinshicho Station is just up the road. When arriving at the station I would advise travellers to take the north exit. All you then have to do is walk westwards down the road. Public transport is very easy. We flew in and from Haneda which is straightforward. We found the easiest way to see most of Tokyo was to take the Sobu Local Lineto Akihabara, and then transfer to the Yamanote Line. The Sobu Line itself goes all the way to Shinjuku. The Hamzomon metro goes to Shibuya. It’s effortless. Five stars!

A great location with subway and it line around the corner. Airport limo bus stop in front of the hotel. Free baby cot provide for infant below 1 year old. Hotel room consider big for Japan standard. Bath tub size is international size compare to mostly Japanese hotel size. SomeFloor come with ice machine (need to check with front desk) 24hour convenience store and eatery is opposite the road. Free shuttle bus for both Disney land and sea. Although this is a “good Disney neighbour hotel” but they don’t have any Disney Channel on tv. WiFi willDisconnect in middle of the night. But overall this is a great hotel.Especially you are travel with kids

Stayed here during a week trip with 2 other friends and this hotel was everything we could have asked for. The room was spacious, and we each had a single bed larger than standard. We booked the non-skytree facing room but the view was still great, looking out over onto the rest of Tokyo. Free water bottles and the toiletries, (including toothbrushes and toothpaste!) were replaced every day, even if we left the room late and there was more than enough for the three us. The complimentary phone to use for calls and data was way over our expectations and came in extremely useful for google maps. The hotel restaurant overlooking the SkyTree was under construction and closed when we stayed but this didn't affect us and we heard no noise within the hotel, despite being in a quieter area of Tokyo but still has a lovely atmosphere and night life with lots of places to eat nearby. There's also a shopping centre and a JR station around a 3 minute walk away which was a nice surprise!Would definitely come back, this was the best hotel i've stayed in yet! And affordable!

In my opinion the hotel has everything what is need to good stay in Tokyo: First of all clean and comfortable rooms, helpful and nice staff and good localization (near to JR and metro station, shops, restaurants)

This was our first time in japan and we could not have chosen a nicer hotel to stay with. Our trip was split beteen Tokyo and Osaka. Tobu Lavant Tokyo sports sapacious family room with lovely view of the sky tree tower made it even better. Located just 5 minutes walk away from Kinshicho statione this hotel whilst being well connected to the city is protected from the hustle and bustle of Tokyo. Friendly and helpful staff make the stay here pleasurable. The breakfast on offer is very good and the hotel is ideally located for taking leisurely walks. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend it too....overall really happy with our stay at TOBU LEVANT TOKYO

They have excellent services and they are very kind. They have plug-in adaptors that is very helpful for the outside Asia tourists. It's a very coasy hotel. The breakfast is EXCELLENT and A LOT of food that you can choose from!

From check in, we arrived about 2 hours earlier, the staff gave us the first good news—she got us in our room early. The 2nd good news came in as we got to our room—the view. While overall its tiny space is functional. The location was near a metro station and lots of food shops & some quick shopping. The great experience was driven by great staff, very helpful in every interaction. Thanks! We’ll never hesitate to come back.

We were happy with everything about this hotel. Stayed 13 nights; close to shopping, and transit. Most gracious people with exceptional customer service. The staff are very helpful in every way. We were pleasantly surprised at how large the room was (2 twin beds and additional couch that turned into another twin). They still used china cups for coffee/tea. towels were supplied everyday as well as toothbrushes/toothpaste and a large abundance of shampoo/conditioner & body wash.The beds were very comfortable and we were able to adjust the heat and air conditioner to suit us at any time. I can't recall exactly how much we paid for each night of stay but knew it was reasonable and would stay there again in a heartbeat! They offer a buffet breakfast ( food was very good) and also offer limousine service to and from the airport (Haneda). Loved staying there!

My stay was great, the hotel is super close to Kinshicho station, 7 eleven and Lawson's. The room was always clean, the staff were very helpful. The best part was the hotel provided a cell phone with WiFi for the length of my stay free of charge. It made my trip and plans so much easier. I was not expecting that. They have a bus that will take you and pick you up from Tokyo Disney and Disney Sea. The buffet breakfast has quite a selection of food to meet anyone's tastes, though I recommend adding the price into your room cost. It was 2500 yen per person if you paid separate. I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone.

We booked a room with the view of the Skytree. Our 12 floor room proved a great view and lit up at night provided a pleasant focal point. Whilst slightly dearer, would recommend paying for this upgrade.The hotel is in a good location to explore the city and the nearest station a five minute walk away. Rooms in the hotel are smaller than most western hotels. However, immaculately clean, comfortable and satisfactory for our needs. A good addition is the smart mobile phone for use by guests to gain access to the internet in the city and indeed phone internationally at no cost.Hotel staff are extremely helpful and very polite. It has to be said this is common to almost all Japanese people who in general go out of their way to be helpful.We have no hesitation in recommending hotel Tobu and would stay there again if we return to Japan

This hotel was fabulous. The personnel could not have been friendlier or more helpful and efficient. The breakfast was truly super and the room, while small by American standards, was comfortable an spotless.

After a 15 hour flight and checking in, was given a room on the 22nd floor.AsI got off the elevator, on my way to my room only to hear a baby cry. The more I approach my room the louder the noise was. Only to find out, next to my room the noise was coming from. The staff was so kind and understanding, that my room was changes and upgrade. The location is great that I barely spent time in my room.I washout early (bus and train station 5 mins away) and in late. Did not get a chance to checkout the amenities offered.

We stayed here for 6 nights in a quadruple room. We had the best view of the Skytree. The room is small compared to hotels in the US but a decent size for Tokyo. Beds were super comfy. The shower was to die for. Wonderful pressure and a huge tub for Asia. The hotel shampoo, conditioner and body wash were all Shesiedo. They smelled heavenly. I really wanted to purchase them but couldn’t find them in the stores. Housekeeping was immaculate in tidying up the room and replenishing toiletries and amenities. The hotel provides free water daily and there’s an ice machine near the elevator. Everyone at the hotel were super polite and helpful.The wifi was a bit tricky but once we asked the front desk we were able to utilize it. The rooms were not completely soundproofed, we could hear our neighbors next door banging around and some stomping, running noises from the floor above. It was not too bothersome since we were out most of the day.The location is great. It is about a 20-30 min walk to Skytree or one metro station away. The metro and Jr are about a 5-10 walk away from the hotel. There are two huge supermarkets near the train station Seiyu and Japan Meat. The mall near the train station has many restaurants on the 10th floor. The restaurants close at 10:30 pm so you can have a late dinner. There are two French bakeries nearby and tons of restaurants around the station. The mall also has Uniqlo, Muji, Gu, and Daiso.The hotel has limousine bus pickup and drop off from both Narita and Haneda airports.We would definitely stay here again. We miss Tokyo already.

Tobu hotel is one of hotel you should choose, the price is medium and many facilities you can try. It located in the center of Tokyo, no worries if you want to go to many place in Tokyo, The food were very good, and variant.

This hotel is a 4-minute walk from Kinshicho train station and is close to tokyo skytree. They have a really grand entrance so you can't miss it. They offer a free shuttle to disney resort. The service is amazing, they went above and beyond when I asked them for direction. The room was a decent size and it was a full size bed. I only stayed here for one night, but it was a pleasant stay.
