review_body: We had been to the restaurant here many times before but this is the first time we stayed at the hotel. We got a big twin room which was very spacious for putting up the baby cot, and we got a room with a view of the trains which our 1.5 year old son absolutely loved. Skytree view would have been nice if it was just adults, but train view was cheaper and provided great entertainment for our child.We did have a few accidents (child related!) such as juice spillage but it was always tidied up very quickly by the helpful staff. Any issues they were dealt with extremely quickly and by very friendly staff. I am very impressed with this hotel and would love to stay again when we visit Tokyo next time. The area has so many shops and other amenities, we were able to get absolutely everything we needed to done locally. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone who can afford it!

We recently stayed at Tobu as a family of 2+3. The staff we encountered were all very friendly especially the receptionist who helped me find a Dr on a Sunday after my daughter put beads in her ears and the gentleman who checked us in. The rooms were all very clean and stocked thank you housekeeping. The fact Tobu has rooms that can accommodate us in one room made things so much easier. The mobile phone available in the room to take out with you was a fantastic and such a great idea. Location wise we found really good easy to get around. There’s a playground five minutes down the road super helpful with kids. Plus there is the free bus to Disney which makes a long day easier. Our only negatives were the coffee prices in the lobby lounge was excessive and the breakfast buffet was a little repetitive after a week. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to family and fiends. We will stay here again when we return to Tokyo.

We selected Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo because of other great tripadvisor reviews, its location and value. Needless to say, we were not disappointed. This hotel is located 3-5 min walking distance from Kinshicho station which has both subway and JR train (Sobu line direct to Narita, without transfers for 1,350 yen) and it takes about 20 to 40 min to get to other areas of interest inside Tokyo. There is a Limousine bus direct from Narita to the hotel but it's only offered twice a day. This hotel also offers a free shuttle bus to and from Tokyo Disneyland which is great if you have little kids, specially on the way back when they are tired. You can also buy Disney tickets at the front desk and skip the 30 minute ticket line at Disneyland (keep in mind that the hotel does not sell fixed-date Disney tickets, which we did not mind, since the crowd forecast was good mid-week)Our room was spacious for Tokyo standards and contained every known gadget and necessity. The cleaners were excellent and very detailed. There was an ice machine in the hallway. The TV offered mostly Japanese TV with one channel that had occasional English news. We were also offered an android cell phone which had unlimited data and voice and was indispensable for google maps and street directions. You could also download apps from Google Play - we downloaded google translate, Tokyo subway app and TDR Alert for Tokyo Disney wait times. The phone's user interface was a bit clunky and ad-supported, but it was a great free service by the hotel. The mattresses were comfortable. There was just a bit of outside noise from the trains and some minor noise from people passing in the hallway, but no different than most places. The email communication with the hotel prior to our arrival was prompt and all of our many questions have been answered in great detail. Everyone from cleaning staff, managers, concierge and the front-desk staff were very polite, knowledgeable and always very helpful. There are 2 convenience stores (Lawson's and 7 Eleven) right across the street from the main entrance and 2 french bakeries (one in the train station and the other one next to the southern entrance) There are many restaurants on the side streets and an entire floor of family friendly restaurants on the 10th floor of the nearby Arcakit shopping center. In case it rains, you almost don't need an umbrella and can go strait from terminal 2 of the train station to the Arcakit shopping center which has hotel access on the second floor (west gate). If it doesn't rain there is a big park nearby (Kinshi park) that has a playground for kids. Across the street from the Kinshicho station (east side) there is an escalator access to the basement of the Rakutenchi building with a big supermarket that's affordable and has a pastry section and a large take-away food section with a very large inventory of prepared foods and sushi. Rakutenchi building also contains several restaurants and fast food places (including KFC and a Subway) as well as a 24/7 onsen (spa) on the 9th floor. Overall - this was a great choice and gets five stars for location, service, convenience and for solving a lot of issues tourists face in Tokyo.

We stayed here for a week, in a room with a view of the Skytree. The room itself was comfortable and the amenities provided were generally of good quality e.g. Shiseido toiletries, Panasonic air cleaner cum humidifier, Blendy drip coffee, Chiyoda-en green tea etc. Housekeeping kept our room spick and span everyday but we think more vacuuming would have been great. Location is perfect, just 7 minutes' walk from Kinshicho station that includes both JR and metro lines (JR Sobu line provides direct access to Narita airport). The only negative was the front desk, which seemed overrun by old and unhelpful staff that had much poorer command of English than they cared to admit. When we asked the middle-aged man who checked us in about the hotel's direct access to the mall and station from the second floor, he dismissed our enquiry by saying we better walk from the ground floor. We found out later by ourselves that it was possible and more convenient to use the second floor access. The same staff also ignored our request for a quiet room and put us right next to the lift lobby so we had to waste time requesting for a room change. The hotel's management will profoundly improve this sleeper of a hotel if only they paid attention to all the slackers manning their front desk!

we had an amazing view of Skytree. the room for 4 was small but it was nice, comfortable beds, the shower was awesome. Free WiFi. very clean. The free loaned cellphone allowed us to access google maps and other useful information at all times which was very helpful. The staff was very kind too.

Large comfortable rooms. Not overpriced. Nice breakfast. Great staff. Next to the train station. Great links to the airport. Next to a shopping mall. Quiet area yet typically lots of dining choices.Free mobile phone amazingly useful and unexpected.Great stay, thank you.

everything was always really clean. I enjoyed my stay immensely! all the amenities were more than I expected. the staff is exceptional. This location is really close to the JR and tokyo metro so we got around cheaply and easily!!

Fabulous hotel, spacious rooms, wonderful amenities. Very close to the train station. We were able to take the JR Sobu line from Narita Airport (about 1350 yen) since our JR passes didn't start till the next day. Nice quiet neighborhood with plenty of shops and restaurants around. Our room had a great view of the Tokyo sky tree. My only regret is not purchasing the Breakfast buffet option ahead of time. Even purchasing it at the hotel each morning, I felt like it was worth it...tons, and I mean tons, of options, both Western and traditional Japanese. And with 4 teenagers, the buffet was money well spent. Front desk staff was very nice and concierge was so very helpful. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again.

LOCATIONBeing one of the TOKYO SKYTREE official hotels. This hotel is in the middle of hot tourist area close to TOKYO SKYTREE, Asakusa, shopping centres along with nice eateries and convenience stores.WONDERFUL VIEW OF TOKYO SKYTREEMy room have beautiful tower view and in-house restaurants, Verdure! Imagine yourself gazing quietly at the sparkling tower at the center of the night sky while resting on your bed or enjoying delicious dinner with your beloved person. It adds up to the romantic atmosphere.SUPERB ACCESSIBILITY TO MAJOR ATTRACTIONSThis hotel has shuttle bus to TOKYO SKYTREE and Tokyo Disneyland. Direct airport limousines operate between our hotel and both Haneda and Narita International Airport.phaTran

review_body: Truly enjoyed our stay in Japan.. Tobu Hotel is by far the best hotel we stayed in. The staff were helpful and accommodating, The room is nice and you have a wide selection of breakfast buffet. Love to go back to Japan again!.

The room I got stank really bad, tried to use the spray they have to clear the smell, but the odor was too strong. The smell reminds me of a dirty locker room towel. I asked the cleaning lady for help, they told me to use the spray in the closet. As for the hotel, it was decent, the outside looked really nice from the lobby, the service was at the lobby was excellent, could use a few more English speaking counter staff. The room itself was clean, along with a good size bathroom. Channel selection on the TV was very limited, no English stations, it was all Japanese. My room had a free cellphone to use with data and voice service, it does come with ads. Data was slower than 4G, but it was free. They stocked bottle water in fridge everyday, room was clean everyday with fresh towels. Can improve on the following:Better in room coffee, coffee was terribleThe room took a long time to cool down, better ACBetter TV channels, no English stationsNo laundry machine room for travelers, we need to wash our clothesRental bikes for guestThe good:Free Disney ShuttleFree Cellphone with data, but kinda of slowClean room and hallwayBig lobbyGood staffQuiet locationAvoid Room 1624, foul smelling room.

A good hotel which offers a nice location - close to Kincho station and to Sky tree. The hotel is big and offers free WiFi, I would have liked a gym though. Big breakfast buffet with both Asian and western offerings.

Stayed with family (2 adults 2 children) for a week in mid June. Stay was fantastic. Hotel staff were all friendly and super helpful. Like all of Japan hotel was spotless. Breakfast buffet was also great; though as others have mentioned, the menu did not rotate. I did see two roaches on two separate locations in the breakfast area; however since the breakfast area was pretty much spotless we did not deter us from eating there again.

Tokyo was at the end of our 8 days Japan tour and we never thought of getting to stay in such a good, luxurious hotel at the capital city within our budget. Thanks to Tobu Hotel for the fantastic accommodation and the great hospitality. Rooms were spacious with all amenities, lifts were very fast, lobbies were grand, breakfasts were splendid and the staff were too polite. We fell at home all the time...

The rooms were spacious and clean, and had a magnificent view of the Tokyo Skytree. Location was conveniently next door to a mall and a train station. Breakfast buffet was above average. Staff were very friendly and service was great.

From check-in to check out, Tobu Levant met my expectations as a superb hotel. Service was efficient especially with Reception and housekeeping...Front desk was fast in letting us check-in our room, not too many forms to fill up like in other hotels... response time from Housekeeping to my request for additional bathroom mat was fast...Room was clean and comfortable and has enough space unlike other hotels in Tokyo...Every floor has an ice dispenser...speed of check-out is noteworthy too...almost all employees have a welcoming nature and are eager to help out guests who need their help...Couldn't ask for more, indeed Tobu Levant made our 9-day Tokyo vacation worthwhile.

Beautiful hotel with a great location. Staff were amazing were so helpful with everything. So close to shops,transport,restaurants,7/11,Family Marts and the amazing Sky Tree Tower. Highly recommend would definitely go back 5*

Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia

review_body: The rooms were spacious and very clean. The Buffett breakfast was the best we had had on our tour. On the 24th floor there was a bar and fabulous view.Staff were very helpful and polite. Close to 2 large shopping centres with lovely quality gifts to take home and the metro station. There are many restaurants near the Metro with yummy food.

My husband and I really enjoyed the relatively spacious, clean and very quiet room, which contained a small refrigerator and love seat. The latter was a bit tired but other than that have no complaints. The hotel's proximity to the Kinshicho station on the Sobu line enabled us to avoid a train station transfer from Narita, which we really appreciated after our long trip. We especially enjoyed the great view of the Tokyo Skytree at night. The hotel room was exceptionally quiet.

Highly recommend - We stayed here after a day at Disney. There is a free shuttle bus from both parks. It's about 30 mins (may be less as we got stuck in traffic). The hotel is clean and easy to navigate, staff are very helpful (although this is typical for Japan). The room was quite cramped but not unusually so for Tokyo. However, we were comfortable (2 adults + 1 child).It is near Sky Tree, which is worth a visit even if you don't plan to go up. There is also a nice gardens/park which you can walk through to get there. You really don't feel like you're in Tokyo, it's so peaceful. The breakfast buffet was superb! There is so much variety and you will want to try everything. You definitely won't need lunch!

This hotel is very close to the metro station so is super convenient for tourists. However at least the superior double we were in was very small. Also the front desk is unbending re offering a later checkout than 11am-I was told I’d have to pay almost $24 US to extend it for another hour! The small room, though, was clean and bed comfortable. However a major redo is sadly in order.

Spacious hotel rooms located conveniently next door to the Kinshicho Station and a couple of large malls. Relatively easy walk (approx 20 minutes) to the Sky Tree Tower. Nice breakfast buffet offering a combination of Western and Japanese foods. The hotel conveniently has regular Airport Limousine bus service to both major airports. Fantastic restaurant on top floor offers delicious Japanese set menus.

The hotel is nice and well functioning. We were there in a period with many guests. The hotel handles this nicely, although it might get crowded at breakfast. Staff is friendly and efficient. Rooms are not very big, but layout is good so you don't really notice it

We are 33 members in the group and stay in this Hotel for Two nights. The Located right next to Kinshicho station allowing easy access to Tokyo’s rail system. Within walking distance of the Tokyo Sky Tree and the Asakusa shopping precinct. Many good eating places & bars nearby. Rooms are good and enough space with nice Toilet. Rooms are large by Japanese standards & come with the usual amenities ( fridge , TV , A/C ,safe etc). Best and Testy breakfast is an experience only because of the number of guests. Great selection of Indian & Western & Japanese food. The best hotel we found on our tour of Japan.

Located right next to Kinshicho station allowing easy access to Tokyo’s rail system. Within walking distance of the Tokyo Sky Tree and the Asakusa shopping precinct. Many good eating places and bars nearby . If you can afford it eat at the restaurant on the hotels 24th floor (Skytree View Restaurant and Bar) and enjoy stunning views of Tokyo by night. If your budget doesn’t stretch that far there is an all you can eat buffet on the 2nd floor.Rooms are large by Japanese standards and come with the usual amenities ( fridge , TV , A/C ,safe etc) and good bathroom.Buffet breakfast is an experience only because of the sheer number of guests. Great selection of Western and Japanese food.The best hotel we found on our tour of Japan.

Located right besides JR Kinshicho station in Sumida-Ku, Tokyo. Also accessible by Tokyo metro Hanzomon Line and the Airport Limousine service from Narita Airport.The location is very convenient and some rooms offer a great view of Tokyo Skytree.I have been here frequently for lunch buffets and the arrangement is wonderful with excellent service.Overall , a great place, location wise.

From all reports, we were expecting a bedroom where there was only room to sleep standing up!What a pleasant surprise to find that the room was very spacious!There was one English channel on TV, but when it came to news time, they dubbed it into Japanese!The breakfast was excellent too.We decided to have dinner in their buffet restaurant and were not disappointed. The range of dishes was fantastic and reasonable priced too.

The hotel is located in close proximity to Kinshicho Station of the Sobu Line and the Chuo-Sobu Line. In fact, there are direct JR trains from Narita International Airport (amost 1.5 hours). To tourists staying at the hotel and using JR passes such a convenient location is extremely advantageous. In addition, a large number of shops and restaurants are within walking distance.The front desk staff is courteous and helpful and understands English perfectly.The room itself is fine, althouh the twin-bed type is a bit small for us with two suitcases and a snowboard bag. The bathroom has a shower and a bath and, of course, all the necessary amenities. Free Wi-Fi service is available.On the first floor there is a smoking room, outside of which there are a couple of vending machines.I will definitely consider staying at the hotel again the next time I visit Tokyo.

good service,,, really nice... if i come back to Tokyo i will visit there. we recommended 5 rooms with family around 15people. we are all felt 100% service. very close shopping center, subway station.

We stayed here for 3 nights in October on the first leg of a round-Japan trip and it ticked all the boxes. Not far from Kinshicho station from which you can basically access the whole of Tokyo reasonably easily, a 20 minute walk from the Skytree (which we had an amazing view of from our room), and a good-sized breakfast buffet with plenty of choice. Add in a comfy bed and a decent-sized room for Tokyo - can't ask for much more than that at a very reasonable price too. If I'm ever lucky enough to be back in Tokyo, I'd gladly stay there again.

Love the location! A lot of eateries around and shopping mall next to the hotel. Breakfast buffet spread was fabulous! Staff are very helpful and polite. The only minus point is the bed and pillows. They were not that comfortable.

Tobu Hotel is very decent and clean. Hotel is relatively quiet with pretty good. Breakfast has a good spread of varieties and staff are pretty friendly. A great view of the Skytree from their restaurant and bar at level 24. Lots of smaller eateries surrounding the hotel and very closed to the train station.

Accesible. Located near the train station.Near the mall and restaurants.Spacious and cleanGood service except the roof top staff. Why? I went there to check out the area and there is signage that it is close,the staff may be tired that she tried to inform me in a not sooo good way that they are close.As to the room: Bed is comfortable and can fit 2 pax.1 sofa bedTemperature is niceWhat i noticed are the pillows.. some are overused and some are okay. When i say overused, its really bad. You can feel beads on. I dont know what are those... beads or what...FOOD- buffet with limited choices. Needs improvement.BATHROOM/TOILET: clean with all the things you need! Overall: nice hotel. Quiet, clean, spacious and good location.

After returning to Japan from Bali, we took the bus from Narita Airport to Tobu Hotel and stayed one night. We were early so they held our luggage while we went to Skytree. This is a beautiful hotel and it was surprisingly affordable. The room was small, but that's a common theme in Japan. Lots of dining options within a short walk. Train station is only 1-2 blocks. Would definitely return here and explore more of Tokyo.

Nice place, near the station, free shuttle from the hanaeda airport and also to Disney, easy to find some foods.The room isnt so small, clean, with friendly staff. Recommended to stay in this hotel. What was amazing also for me, they gave me room with Tokyo sky tree view.

I stayed 4 nights in Tobu Hotel. Good location, near to kinshicho station exit North just 2 min walk.Comfort and clean room.Near to Family Mart and Lawson.Check-out is 11 am, you must pay if you want to late check out.

Stayed two nights at Tobu Hotel Levant. From walking in the door you can discern clear high level of service from the ever attentive, knowledgeable and helpful staff. If reception staff are busy, another staff member will come over to enquire what you need. Rooms are very large, especially by Tokyo standards, and our view of the Skytree from the 12th floor was astounding. Beds were comfortable, rooms clean, buffet breakfast was an extensive mix of western and asian foods, all of high quality. We had the buffet dinner one night and it was superb, with far more options than anyone could consume. Location is very handy to Kinshicho rail station for any freelance city sightseeing you may wish to indulge. Also a very easy, short walk to Skytree

I am in the middle of a 4 day stay here and went up to the bar for a relaxing drink after a big day walking around and the staff said there is a 600 yen charge per person to enter, I politely declined and said I would take my business elsewhere. The Hotel is ok and clean which is what I would expect for what you pay. Really could do with a gym also.

We stayed in a quad room for our family of two adults and two teenagers, rather cosy but perfect for our needs. The hotel lobby is lovely and the staff were all excellent. Room amenities were plentiful. We were on the side overlooking the railway tracks, you can hear a bit of train noise but it was not particularly bothersome - I am a light sleeper, foam earplugs did the trick. Otherwise no noise from the hallway or adjoining rooms at all. For travellers arriving from Narita Airport, if you can figure out the train system, you can actually get a direct train from the airport to the station next to the hotel. The hotel is located in a relatively quiet area of Tokyo, I absolutely loved the area and with the station so close, everywhere is easily accessible. There are plenty of bars and restaurants near the hotel and a big shopping centre right next door. Go to the roof of the shopping centre for a great view of Skytree and surrounding suburbs. Skytree is just over a kilometre away, and a very enjoyable walk along relatively quiet streets. The hotel offer a ticket deal where you can visit two levels of Skytree at a discounted price if you go before a certain time in the morning. I highly recommend this, we got there just after 8am and virtually had the place to ourselves. I would especially like to thank this hotel for organising a refund for one night of our pre-booked stay after our airline cancelled our flight, delaying our arrival by a day. We did not think this would be possible due to the short notice and it was totally appreciated as we discovered our travel insurance excludes flight cancellations from their cancellation policy. So thank you, we hope to return one day to this great hotel.

The Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo was a great place to sleep, shower, and store my gear while exploring Tokyo. I spent most of the day out and about, so I didn't need much of a room or luxuries. The hotel seems to be luxuriously decorated and the appliances and room decor are excellent and well maintained.My room was the smallest room I've ever been in, which was ideal for this trip. Through the door was a short hall the length of the bathroom and then the room which was mostly the queen or full size bed. There was a desk/counter space along the foot of the bed (at the end of the hall) with a TV, phone, and lamp. Then along the one side of the bed near the window was a chair, air purifier, and end table. The head board extended from the bathroom wall (the bed was flush with the bathroom wall and headboard) to the window and contained controls for the room lights and a reading light. The bathroom was average sized with a deep tub/shower and a toilet with the Japanese bidet seat. The room was the perfect size for the type of trip I was on, efficient and comfortable without the luxurious space.The hotel contained a rooftop bar was formal and quiet, charged an seat/entrance fee. They did give us an appetizer (?)... an un-appetizing cracker with a sardine (?) and pate concotion. I was not a fan. There were bars up and down the street in front of the hotel, so this was not a problem.The hotel restaurant contained a pretty decent breakfast buffet, but for the cost we only ate there once on our four night stay.The hotel was clean and quiet. The staff was courteous and spoke decent english. My favorite parts of my stay at this hotel was the 'right-sized' room and the hotel is a drop off/pick up point for the Limousine Bus from Narita Airport as well as Haneda Airport. Also, the Kinshicho Station is a very short walk with a Starbucks at the station. There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the close area, as well as 7-11, Lawsons, and Family mart in close proximity.My least favorite part of this hotel is the hotel bar. It would have been nice to sit down for a beer with my friends after a day of exploration, but I felt compelled to order a scotch or bourbon or glass of wine and underdressed in anything but a suit and tie. It's a nice option to have the classy bar with the jazz band on the one night staycation with the wife or after the company function in the hotel, but I need the Cheers type beer bar with the jukebox or TV sports after a day of hiking or subway riding. Tocci is across the street and there are a couple of english pubs down by the station.Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Spent a week here for the most recent Tokyo business trip and really enjoyed it. Super quick to and from Haneda via Keikyu / JR on the way in and taxi & TCAT bus on the way out. Room was a nice size for Tokyo and the bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. Also good strong free wifi. I used to live close to here so was very nice to be "home" and visit some of my regular haunts. Between JR & Honzomon-sen accessing anywhere in Tokyo is very easy. I did not do breakfast rather opting to go grab a pastry at the Vie de France at the South Exit of the JR station. Plenty of options very close to make your stay convenient.I also saw they did a daily Takyubin collection / packing service which is nice if you want to pre-send suitcases or boxes to the airport.

This hotel appears ok on first impressions however it doesn't take long to be disappointed. The rooms are small even by Japanese standards with total lack of facilities. We needed an iron & ironing board but were told there were none available . . . for two days, when enquiring if we could have clothes pressed also told would take 24 hours. No gym or pool & the location is miles from anywhere.

We recently stayed two nights at this hotel when our train to Matsumoto was canceled due to rain and we were forced to scramble to find last minute accommodations. I usually research hotels extensively before booking so I was nervous about the spur of the moment selection of this hotel. Turns out I had nothing to worry about. Rooms were immaculately clean and spacious by Japanese standards and beds were comfortable. Best of all, it was great for families as it was one of the few hotels I could find offering more than two twin beds per room. Location was great - just a quick one stop from Tokyo station. And for the very central location, the price was incredibly reasonable. I wouldn't hesitate to book again!

Stayed 6 nights, great location close to train station, Sky Tree, shopping mall, restaurants and parks. Hotel staff were extremely nice and our room was perfectly serviced every day. Special shout out and thanks to the housekeeping team on 16th floor for their dedicated service and attention to detail.Highly recommend this Hotel and would stay again next time our family visits Tokyo.

Everything was outstanding. I truly enjoyed my stay. The hotel staff were professional and courteous. I felt safe in my room that had a great view. The restaurant serves delicious cocktail and amazing dinners. Thank you.

Good clean hotel next to the train station. Very helpful staff and restaurant service was very good. Rooms quite small but clean and well serviced. Dinner and breakfasts were excellent. Plenty of restaurants and activity nearby

I will stay in this hotel in my next stay in Tokyo since the location is perfect (3 minutes walk to JR station and 5 minutes to metro station), the room is clean, front desk is helpful and friendly, and the view of sky tree is amazing.

We stayed in this hotel for our short holiday in Tokyo. The location of this hotel is near Kinshico Train station (approx.200 m) and close to Tokyo Skytree. Even you can arrange your Skytree travel thru this hotel. Transportation from and to Narita and Haneda Airport is very easy as Airport Bus Limousine is bring you in front of hotel and pick you up to the airport from this hotel. Looking for restaurants near the hotel? They are plenty, so you won't get hungry. Convenient stores like 7 eleven, lawson and familymart are very close. For interior, the room is bigger for Tokyo size. Bathroom is very clean with Shiseido soap n shampoo. Also its even provide with air purifier and drink water bottle. The staffs are very helpful, and have good english and willing to help you. Certainly will come back again when visiting Tokyo.

We stayed for a night in this hotel. Room was small but had all the facilities. Free WiFi was available with good speed. Toilets are different in Japan and are electrically operated and the seat is warm. You shouldn't sit for long to avoid chances of getting burnt. Location was very good and near market place with some super markets nearby. There is a metro station within 2 minutes walking distance. The hotel is far from airport. Sky Tree tower was visible from our 7th floor room and is within walking distiance. Next day morning we had breakfast and they offered many items like breads, fruits and juices, pastries, rice , eggs etc just to name a few.

Stayed in standard twin room facing the railway (opposite of skytree view room) on 22nd floor in June for 4 nights. The bed was comfy. Not hard but firm. They have 2 extra pillows and a comforter in the wardrobe cabinet. A safe was also provided inside the cabinet. The standard room was bigger than the usual Japanese hotel room. The breakfast was great on 2nd floor. Many selections from Japanese menu ( nabe, curry, miso soup, porridge) & western breakfasts menu (cereals, bread, croissants, bacon, egg, sausages, etc).The wifi was fast around 20 MBps when I measured. The location was great although from the Haneda airport where I landed there was no direct connection to the Kinshicho station near the hotel. Many restaurants and convenience stores nearby the hotel. Akihabara is just 3 stops away by JR Line. FYI, the JR line and metro subway line are not integrated to one another although you can still exit the JR Kinshico station and walk into the metro station underground a few hundred meters away.There are also shopping centres nearby although not as big as malls.Overall I very much recommend this hotel.

Close to JR station, metro station, shopping mall, and lots of restaurants, coffee shops. Two bed room is nice and the view from our room is great.Travelers can take Airport Limousine Bus to Narita and Haneda Airport from Hotel.

The Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo is perfectly located at a JR station, shopping center, restaurants, and convenience stores (but still a quiet, beautiful neighborhood feel). The hotel is clean and comfortable, with great amenities - free wifi, free water and green tea, a well-stocked bathroom with incredible shampoo, robes, and slippers. As a family of 4 with 2 teens, we especially appreciated being able to get a room with 4 comfortable twin beds so everyone had their own space. The staff were friendly. polite, and helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo and would only choose this hotel for our next Tokyo visit.

The hotel was well located with easy access to the train station (Hanzomon Line and Jr Chuo Sobu Line), about a 2-minute quick walk. From Haneda Airport to the hotel, it's about 60 minutes using the Airport Bus Limousine.We got the Standard Rooms with a fantastic view of the Tokyo Skytree and glad that the room was very spacious, almost 30sqm. It was very clean and they have a humidifier in all rooms.The breakfast was really good also.The location may be excellent as it's very close to the train station, however, it takes about 25-35 minutes by train to go to Shinjuku and Shibuya Stations as it's at the opposite side. It's very close to Akihabara though.With a good location and excellent service, I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely return.

The best hotel for a family with small kids. With its location near the train station, easily accessible convenience stores just across the street,very courteous employees and efficient services, clean room everyday- this hotel is worth every penny. Good job Tobu Levant Hotel!

Thanks for making sure I got to the airport on time. I almost missed the flight because I drank too much Sake and over slept. Lady front desk was rushed and ran out side and got the taco for me!! what a service

The hotel was well located with easy access to the train system. The staff was very friendly and helpful with limited English speaking but we were able to communicate. The room was small but adequate and clean.

Great location and excellent service. Lots of shops and restaurants around and just minutes to the station. Extremely clean at every details. All staff are so friendly and helpful. Particularly love the free bus to Disleyland and the booking of the bus to the airport.

Room size is much bigger than the normal Japanese hotel. The buffet breakfast is excellent. Had varied choices. The subway and shopping mall with food courts are located very close to the hotel. The internet speed is also very good. Highly recommended
