Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: This is a large business style hotel, right next to a subway station - many restaurants and convenience stores within yards of hotel. Not new, but spotless and well maintained. room smallish - could not get large bed so settled for twins. Some noise from trains, and from some creaking source just outside our room's window, but heard no noise from within hotel. TV (no Eng channels), wifi (cut out a couple of times, but free) frig, and water heater - most, or all of literature in Japanese. Buffet breakfast included - very large with both Japanese and western items. Not close to most attractions, but subway convenient.

I had a room with kingsize bed on 16 facing Tokyo Sky Tree. I think room number with odd are all facing to sky tree. Room size is more than one would expect per Japanese hotel standard. Breakfast on 2nd floor offer really good buffet. Location is very comfortable near by Kinschicho. One of the rare hotels that strict "smoking" and it's the one. You hardly smell "cigarettes" yet they provide a smoking room on Ground floor nearby vending machines that offer "noodles" "drinks" and "cigarettes." Outside temperature was 19 degree and I didn't need to use air condition.

It's a bit on the pricey side. Aside from that though, everything else was great, especially the staff and the breakfast buffet. The staff was very kind and the buffet had a wide selection of good food. Would definitely stay again, but maybe not for full price.
user_name:
Dae In K
Seoul, South Korea

review_body: The view of Tokyo Tower from the rooms is stunning. Breakfast buffet was very nice but there was a wait to get a table. Rooms are large and comfortable. Elevators are very slow. Location is excellent and several eateries close by.

We stayed here with our family booking two rooms. One with quadruple bed and another room with king size extra big bed. As you may expect the rooms in japan hotels are quite small but this one in particular has a bit more room. The amenities that you expect are all there. Quality of soap and shampoo are considered good quality compared to the average hotel in japan.In terms of service the staff and concierge are quite helpful and can speak very good English. The staff even printed out specific directions and cost for subway/train rides for us. When asked for an electric adapter they had it with no problem. If you need to leave your luggage when you check out and are waiting for a flight then no worries they will help you with that without any charge.Two great things about this hotel, first is that for both rooms we had a great view of the Tokyo Sky Tree [This is a must ask when you check it]. Secondly, location is really really good it's close by to Tokyo Metro Kinschicho Station so you are only a few stops a way from Asakusa and Ueno. Around the hotel are a lot of local restaurants [coin]. Across the street and on the 2nd floor of the hotel is also a Family Mart. Also right next door is Arcakit shopping mall which you can spend a few hours doing last minute or late shopping for Uniqlo, GU, Daiso, do some dining, snacks, deserts, super market, clothes, bags, Zara, and if your traveling with babies you're in luck because they have a whole floor/shop dedicated to baby supplies. So all in all this is a great place to stay at where everything you may need is in walking distance of no more than 250 meters.The only thing I would note is that check in and out are pretty strict so don't expect everything to be ready if you arrive at noon when check in time is at 2 PM [This is pretty standard and expected at all Japanese hotels].

There are two things noteworthy of this hotel- the rooms facing the sky tower and the engaging lobby.The decor of the lobby catches your attention, the vast expanse, the configuration and the shop. From the room, the colorfully lit Sky tower keeps you tuned to it . And then in the lobby shop, you feel tempted to buy the sky tower model. The rooms are pretty good but a bit on the small side. The breakfast spread is ok. There are a few all-night departmental stores just opposite this hotel. We spent 2 nights and will return in future.

We stayed 2 nights at Tobu Hotel Levant, Tokyo on our recent vacation trip to Japan. A very nice, clean, comfortable hotel. This hotel is centrally located in Tokyo and one can find Airport Limousine from Narita airport (unfortunately only two scheduled transfers, one around 10:30 AM and other at 5:20 PM) that will take you directly to Tobu Hotel for about $25/person. B'fast was just superb.

It was a very good hotel overall. In the middle of the Tokyo. Very close to skytree. Rather its a partner hotel with skytree and Disneyland Tokyo. The view from our room was of Skytree it was beautiful. We could see the full Skytree from our window. Only one problem we faced and that was there was queue for breakfast in the restaurant and that was funny we had to wait for 30-40 min for breakfast. Rest it was a good experience.

We were very impressed, staff were wonderful. Very clean rooms and everything was close by, Cafes, shops, train stations and a beautiful park for the kids to play and run around. Tobu runs busses to DisneySea, Disneyland and to the airport.

Tobu hotel is a very good view comfortable and clean hotel, I recommend Tobu hotel for travelers especially family. Location is extremely excellent for night view, can see Sky Tree Tower very clearly.

As first time visitors to Japan we were unsure of which area to stay , but after choosing the Tobu Lavant hotel in Sumida we were very happy with our choice . The hotel is very close to Kinshicho station . The room and staff were excellent and the many small restaurants have yummy food . As first time visitors to Japan I would advise anyone to invest some time in getting a handle on Tokyo's rail system in particular Tokyo station , it's a nightmare for tired travellers and rail staff speak no English .

This hotel was recommended to me by a friend. We were a family of 6. We booked two adjacent rooms for a good rate, with compli buffet breakfast. The rooms were spacious with a mini sofa, and with a picturesque view of the iconic Tokyo Sky Tree. The buffet was exceptional with lots of choices. The reception desk staff were all friendly, accommodating, warm & efficient. Special thanks to Mzel , the Filipina Desk Officer who made our stay most comfortable. The best part was that the hotel provided free shuttle service to & fro Tokyo Disneyland & Disney Sea. Just across the hotel are numerous 24hr convenience stores with Lawson as my fave. Lots of ramen & yakinuku restos too. Yoshinoya too. Starbucks nearby.We took a walk at past 12midnite and the neighborhood, just like most of Japan, was safe. We will definitely stay here again for future trips.
user_name:
ChristineB441
Quezon City, Quezon City, Philippines

review_body: Staff were friendly and accommodating.Room was clean. Walking distance to the train station.(kinshico station) and Skytree.....Walking distance to the mall and restaurants. What else can you ask for.

Good hotel and service. The reception was polite and gave instructions where things were. The room was clean with everything you need. View from floor 20 is great and you can see the Sky tower. I recommend

Stayed 8 nights in 4 bedded room in December 2016. The reason we choose Tobu Levant was because of the affordable room rates, as the usual 4 bedded room we stayed in Shinjuku was almost 2.5 times of Tobu. However, we did not regret a bit.Room size is quite small, but not a problem for us as we spent very little time in the room. Appreciate that the beds are 4 single beds and not the usual sofa beds that most hotel chain provide. Good location as there are plenty of restaurants, convenient stores around the hotel. We make use of the free shuttle bus to Disneyland and it was a breeze. Train station is just a stone throw away. The airport limo bus goes right to the hotel from airport. However, on the return trip, we were unable to use the limo bus from the hotel, as there were only 2 timings to Narita airport.Hotel staff were the most helpful we have met. Special thanks for Mr Tomoki at the front office, he patiently helped us with our enquires and made taxi booking for us. He provided us with masking tape for our extra baggage even before we ask for it.Should we visit Tokyo in the future, we will surely choose Tobu Levant again.

I lile the loation and have a good view.it is near the train station.so, it is very easily to use.the room bed is very comfortable and I can sleep welll.for my family tour trip, this is very suitable for us.Good hotel, Good service

Everything is nice and cleanThe room not too big but not too smallRoom service was very kind and done perfect jobAnd the view.IT WAS BEAUTIFULThe front desk,entrance employees were very kind.The overall hotel looks clean and nice tooI definitely recommend here

Good location, and good reception.But the four-bed room is just as small as the twin room, and the bed of the 4-bed room is smaller than the bed of the twin.連泊 and no cleaning didn't in accordance with the commitments to the concessions.

Spent 4 nights here after skiing in Hakuba. The lobby is large and inviting and the reception staff are very helpful and speak English well. We had a room with 2 3/4 size beds and they were very comfortable. Bathroom is compact but very neat and convenient. The hotel is sorrounded by restaurants and there's a convenience store across the road. 2 doors up the street there's a large shopping plaza with a big supermarket in the basement and a UNIQLO store on level 5. There's also a Starbucks on street level. There's a metro/JR station next to that which is within 5 minutes walk from the hotel, so access to the rest of Tokyo is very easy. You can walk to the Tokyo sky tree in about 30 minutes. The buffet breakfast is great with lots of choice and there is a range of vending machines in a room off the lobby. A great hotel for all the right reasons.

Typical size room in Japan, very clean and secure. Staff spoke English, they were very kind and helpful. Hotel is close to the train station which has shopping and a grocery store beneath it. Breakfast was a little expensive but was delicious and had a huge selection. 7/Eleven across the street for the little things. Bus to the airports.

We were visiting Tokyo for the first time and chose the Tobu for its location - very close to Kinshicho Station which has both a JR line and a Metro station. Also the Arcakit shopping centre is almost next door with heaps of shops and a great restaurant floor. We got a Standard Twin Room with extra bed for third person. We didn't get the Skytree view but looked out on the railway lines, which was very interesting, and we had a tiny glimpse of the Tokyo Tower.In case anyone is wondering the beds are essentially large single beds. You couldn't sleep more than one in each.Check-in was an absolute breeze. We came around 7pm from the airport and they were all ready for us. We had been expecting a package and they advised they had already sent it up to the room.The room was really comfortable with all the amenities you could think of needing in the bathroom, including a hairdryer, and every day they gave us three bottles of water to drink.We were out every day from early till late and didn't use any facilities in the hotel other than our room but it was always immaculately made up when we returned every night.We checked out fairly early (6.15am) and discovered there wasn't anyone on duty to get us a taxi except the guy on the front desk. He ran out into the street and tried to hail us one but eventually came back and said we should walk down to the station to try and find one. That part freaked me out because we had a Shinkansen to catch but almost as soon as we stepped out the door a taxi came by which we hailed and all was well.Great stay and I recommend the location for anyone visiting Tokyo.

The location is good, it takes only 5 minutes to JR station and there are several big shopping malls, supermarket and restaurants nearby. It is convenient for travellers who are going to Disneyland as the hotel provides free shuttle bus. The room is very clean and tidy although the size isn't big. The price is reasonable.

Decent room size for Tokyo. Location is pretty good as you have close access to the trains, department stores, local ramen shops etc.Extremely clean (as expected of Japan hospitality)Free transit to Disneyland

We stayed here for three nights. A nice affordable hotel to be the base for your Tokyo stay. It has direct Airport Limousine access to both Haneda and Narita airports which is helpful if you have large or many luggage. The Kinshicho station (for both JR and Tokyo metro) is 5-7min away. Easy to get to Shibuya, Shinjuku. We also did a full day walking tour on our own to the Tokyo Skytree, Asakusa, Sumida and Ryokogu areas. You will need more than one day if you plan to spend more time in the attractions. Many cheap places to eat around here, as well as a mall near the Kinshicho Station.

I will stay again at your hotel soon. In next March I will go to Tokyo on a business trip and stay your hotel. Because your service and location was very impressed for me. I will suggest to my friends and family to your Hotel for staying.

Nice hotel, very strategic, hotel location easy to find, close to shopping area and many restaurant around, comfort room and clean, the reception staff also kind, he help us made a reserve for limousiene bus to haneda airport

The hotel is conveniently located near the Kinshicho Station. Since it was near a big train station, there was a plethora of restaurants, cafes, shops and convenience stores to choose from. In fact, I could see JR tracks down below from my hotel window! There was the option of views of the Skytree, but that cost extra. The current views were good enough. Upon entering the grand lobby, we were greeted by the polite and courteous front desk staff. The check-in process was smooth and stress-free. They even gave us hot hand towels to use while we waited. I thought that was a nice touch.The room was ordinary and nothing to write home about, but I do have to hand it to them to being able to fit four single beds in a single room. No need for two of us in our group of four to sleep on futons on the floor! The bed was comfy and I had no problems with it. The complimentary wifi was good and had decent speeds. I didn’t try any of their restaurants, so I can’t comment about that.Overall I had a good stay and wouldn’t mind coming back again.

Suitable for people that wanna do some crazy shopping in Tokyo...nice bed to rest with a stunning view of the sky tree tower .The location of the hotel is just perfect,few minutes walk from the station and there are convenient stores and restaurants around the hotel!

The room size is spacious and there are transport services provided to Tokyo Station and Airport as well which makes it very convenient for us. The service is also very good and the location is excellent. There are shopping malls and a vast array of eateries for us to choose. In conclusion, it was really a satisfying stay and I will choose this hotel again if I come back to Tokyo next time.

From my room (2005) I can see the skytree right out side the window. The breakfast was also very good. and it was really convenient to get to Haneda airpot by limousine bus. The location is also great, it is just 2-3 min walk away from Nisikityo Station.

Very good hotel with a great view of sky tower. Nice rooms and very family friendly hotel. Great Breakfast serves both western and Asian tastes.Close to subway and JR station. Hotel is also directly served by airport limousine bus which is very nice . Cherry on the top is the free shuttle to Disney land from the hotel !

Receptionist without japanese meticulous service but inpatient.I've been visited japan for 10 times but even in country B&B we could feel the human touch and dedicated service.I don't know why a famous hotel couldn't?

Walking distance to Kinshicho station (3-5mins walk) can find quite a few of japanese restaurant across the road. Burger king and macdonald around the area too. A 7 storey departmental store next to the station. Good location to stay in. The air-conditioning in the room is a little warm, I prefer the authum air outside. Can hear the train moving because my room can see the train track, not very loud with the sealed window.

Hotel staffs are friendly and kindness, the rooms are clear and comfortable, the location is great that near by station and very convenient to find kinds of meal, and of course including shopping. The best choice when we come again.

Service very good, I like it!In addition to the room hair dryer I think you can change a little better, because the wind is very small, so I think it should be better!In addition are very good, great room and view!

The room is much bigger than in Tokyo area. Room rate is reasonable. Location is a bit far from main district. Overall experience is good. My room is twin queen bed. Bed is big and comfortable.The Skytree is only 30 minutes walk from hotel.

A very convenient location and a lovely room are just two highlights of this hotel. What sets it truly apart is the incredible view from higher floor, odd-numbered rooms. A huge part of Tokyo plus the amazing Sky Tree Tower is smack dab in the middle,of your view from your hotel window. That alone was worth staying here. But the hotel has a good buffet breakfast, and is convenient to shopping and restaurants plus is a short walk to the subway station.

Very recommended hotel to stay in Tokyo, only one station away to Tokyo Skytree and also has a free shuttle bus to Tokyo Disney Resort. The hotel also next to the Arca Kit Mall and surrounded with convenient store like Lawson and Seven Eleven.

From the moment we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff, who helped with luggage and checked us into our room efficiently. We had a room with four single beds as we were a family of four. The room was large enough for our one night stay, but would have been quite small for longer stays, due to limited floor space. The view from our 17th floor room was quite nice, with views over Tokyo towards the Tokyo tower. Rooms on the other side of the hotel had views of the Skytree, if you wanted to pay extra. The buffet breakfast had a good mix of western and Japanese options, and the hotel accommodated our late checkout request, however we did have to pay extra. The location is close to Kinshicho station and is quite convenient. The area has lots of shopping and restaurants but is not very touristy. We were particularly impressed by one of the concierge staff who not only managed to handle both of our heavy suitcases, but also went out of his way to converse in English with us. He always greeted us with a smile and was helpful in translating a website, and helping us locate a shop we wanted to visit. Overall we had a good short stay.

We found the Good Neighbour Hotel benefits (ie the convenience of the free shuttle bus to Disney Resorts) gives the most value of staying in Tobu Hotel Levant.It is not easy to find quadruple rooms in Tokyo, but Tobu does offer a good option, albeit cramp room. I would prefer the nicely decorated room with modern Japan themed wallpaper, but I found the room looks really basic. Nevertheless, it was clean and everything works, ample toiletries.There is also a shuttle to SkyTree Tower, although it is not free - again, it is very convenience. The view of SkyTree Tower from the hotel room is also a really good bonus.Within walking distance to Kinsichio train station.Hotel website is not fully functional in English, I had to make international call to the hotel for help to reserve the Disney shuttle, which thankfully they entertained.Service overall is great.

Stayed here on trip to see new partner company in Kinshi. Just 5 minutes walk away so perfectly placed for me. Quite large for Tokyo rooms are clean tidy and well appointed. Usual Tokyo you can watch CNN and remove bi lingual translation once you have read the translation card. wifi is good. Face time to UK OK. Local 7eleven. Close kinshicho station so if you can work out the maps Narita by train should be easy will find out on Weekend. Limousine bus to TCAT and then Taxi just as economic, it was late at night on arrival. Great hotel overall breakfast OK fantastic if you have come from factory guest house in Philippines. Will stay again

The room was lovely and super clean, and the Internet connection was reliable and fast. I travel at least four months out of the year and often stay at five star hotels, and staying here was very comfortable.

Very nice hotel. Located conveniently to everything from train station to shopping and everyday eatery. Free shuttle bus to Disneyland very helpful though taking a train is super easy as well. My kids love this place a lot. Hotel staffs are extremely helpful too. Highly recommended.

good location and nice service, and the room is spacious. it's easy to reach Skytree, Disney and Odaiba. but there is no convenient way to Narita Airport, must transfer at least 2 times, takes a lot time.

Simple and clean hotel in Tokyo, with plenty of amenities. Close to the train station, lots of great restaurants and shopping. Was only here on business two nights. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I've experienced in Japan, and that's saying something. The staff were fast and friendly, the croissants were beautifully baked and the fresh orange juice machine was pumping out the freshest orange juice I've had in a while. So good!

Nice view,nice service,good location,and very convent.I love this hotel,also my family dose.This was wonderful memory to live here.my kids was very very happy and exciting to see the sky city.if we go to Japan again, we will choose the hotel again

The room is clean with all the essential supplies. It close to one of the shopping center and the metro and JR station. It takes 10 minutes walk to the skytree tower. The employees are nice and helpful for your question.

We stayed just one night in a room with 4 beds. All very clean and, for local standars, quite spacious. Lots of small complementary items, typical in Japan, but that make your stay even more enjoyable. Friendly and very helpful staff. The view from the room (15th floor) was amazing, especially at night. Would definitely go back.

Everything are perfect during the trip in Tokyo until I found my iPad lost in the Hotel. Fortunately, I get my iPad by their warm help. I highly recommend the Tobu Levent Hotel in the best choice if you want to live shortly in Tokyo.

I was originally thinking about booking a hotel in more central area of Tokyo, but staying at this hotel ended up being a great decision. Sky Tree view room is worth paying for!! You can see the Sky Tree right there in front of you when you open the window. Morning view and night view were different, and both equally beautiful. There are two different colors of Sky Tree lighting at night, and the color alternate every day. We were also lucky enough to see the fireworks up right next to the Sky Tree.This hotel is 4 minutes walk from/to the Kinshicho Station, one station away from the Sky Tree station (you can also walk there), two stations away from Asakusa station. Easy access to any Tokyo tourist areas, yet situated in more quiet downtown Tokyo.Hotel staffers were all very friendly and pleasant. Room was a bit small, but efficient and functional. I had absolutely no complaint.Across from the hotel, there are two convenience stores, Yayoi-ken where you can eat very cheap (about $5) and delicious Japanese breakfast (or lunch), and many cafes and bakery around and inside of the Kinshicho Station. I will strongly recommend to eat breakfast at a bakery (not cafe) at least once! I will write more about it in the restaurant area.I will go back to this hotel again if they continue to provide a room with a reasonable price!

We stayed with two children (8 and 11) and had four singles beds in the room. It was a great space; very clean. The location was awesome- very easy walk to a JR station. We splurged a little and had a view of Tokyo SkyTree which was amazing to see at night. This was the most expensive hotel we have ever stayed at, but for Tokyo prices it was a good deal.

Location slightly out of beaten tourist track (vicinity of Tokyo Sky tree).Room we were given more than suitable for 2 adults and 2 older kids. Fantastic view of Tokyo skyline. Breakfast buffet with continental and Oriental option. I think there are several restaurants but we did not use them. Concierge very helpful especially their luggage transfer service.Highly recommended.

I stayed for a couple of nights at the Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo, and had a comfortable stay. The staff both at the Front Desk and the Concierge is very friendly and helpful. Walking distance to the shopping centre is 5-15 minutes away. I’m sure I’ll be back next time.

Stayed here both at the beginning and end of our Japan holiday. Chosen for its location to the JR line, it proved to be a convenient for getting to our tours. Four twin beds in a room made it so much more cost effective than the two twin rooms we had to book elsewhere. The first time we stayed on the side facing the railway tracks. We weren't bothered by noise but the view wasn't great. Used the free shuttle to Disney to get to our Disney Resort Hotel. The second time, I upgraded us to a skytree view room on the 21st floor. It was amazing and worth the $6000 yen per night surcharge. Even got to watch fireworks from our room on our last night. Family Mart on the second floor or 7-11 across the street for quick stop if you need anything. Otherwise the big malls are just a 3-5 minute walk by the station. Quiet area. Great choice for families.

Great location with reasonable price. A "sky tree" view is a must! Close to JR and Metro and lots of nice restaurants around the neighborhood. There's also supermarket and drug store in the basement of "KIT" department which is just 1 minute walking from the hotel. Lawson and 7-11 are just in front of the hotel entrance. Super convenient.

Great view，everyon is kind,room cleam.Friendly counter staff explained the hotel to the airport bus service, and to help us to a restaurant reservation, feel clean and tidy every day back to the hotel room is the most relaxing break.

Yes, it's a good location for shopping 、 transportation、nice staffs and people said wonderful view toward to sky tree tower , however, I hated that sofa bad and spring noise, I want a normal bed.. I paid high price and fell discomfort....I think have many hotels to choose next time

My husband told me not to expect much when he booked 2 nights here at the end of our Japan trip. It was way cheaper than other places we had stayed. However it was such a nice surprise to find we got the biggest rooms we had had in 3 weeks, spotless rooms and with nice bedding. My sons room on the floor above had newer carpet but otherwise the rooms were very good. The staff are exceptionally friendly. The hotel is 4 stations out from Tokyo on the JR line so very convenient. In walking distance from the SkyTree. We had views of Tokyo from the 21st floor which enjoyed. Good air con. Lots of local good places and a great supermarket at the train station. I was really pleased with this hotel.

Great location, staff and nearby stores and restaurants as well as the JR line and metro system! Starbucks and Zara is just around the corner and you can get tickets for the metro and JR line from the front desk.

good place, located in queit place, staff gave me good service. air conditioner and other appliance have good condition. we had good experience with this hotel. we are happy to stay with this hotel and want to stay again

This Hotel was quality. The entrance is grand, and at check in we were offered an upgrade to a room with s view of Tokyo sky tree for 3000yen which we took. It was worth it as the view from our room was special. The furnishings, bed and linen were all very good quality. The only small thing was the hotel did not supply milk on any firm for our western taste. The hotel also sells tickets to the Tokyo sky tower and had a bus device to it for a cost. It proved handy to buy the tickets at the Hotel as we had less wait time The location of the Hotel is near Kinschicho station a short subway ride from Tokyo and then a short walk from the left hand side of the exit.

We visitied Japan for the first time and decided to stay at Tobu Levant hotel for 3 nights. We glad we picked this one. We traveled with 3 young kids and stayed in the quad room which was reasonably good in size considering the room size we looked and checked in other hotels in Japan. Location was perfect for us, 5 mins walk to Kinsicho station for hoth train and subway. It took 3 stops to akihabara to visit electronic city and 5 stops to Ueno for all the parks and museums. It was around 30 minutes to reach shibuya or ginza by train/subway. Skytree was walking distance though we took the subway as we travelled with young kids. The hotel provided free shuttle to disney too.The location had that local residential ambiance with more locals around, less tourists, as bycicles roaming the pedestrians during the day.There were plenty of food options and some opened 24hrs which was great. Plenty of 24hrs mini shops too. No pools which was ok, as we the weather was warm but not hot during our visit. Overall, it was a nice stay at tobu levant.

Hotel was a bit old however the room furnishing is better and not tiny as we expected. Staff are polite and always helpful. Room amenities are generous. Distance to train station about 200m. Convenient store is nearby along with individual specialised restaurant across the road e.g. sushi, korean bbq, japanese skewers and bbq. Its near skytree as well.

We stayed in quad room with Skytree View which was quite amazing especially at night. Family of 2 adults, 2 children and a baby so there was very little space left in the room but we found the same everywhere in Japan and just planned not spending too much time in room. Very convenient bus service that took us to Disneyland and also upon checking out we took bus to Tokyo main station to catch Shinkansen as it was much easier with luggage over taking local train. Great selection of restaurants and shopping. Weather wasn't the best during our 4 days in Tokyo but hotel staff very helpful with ideas for places to go.

The hotel location is good, closed to station and skytree (around 15 mins by walk.) There are many shopping stores around. We like its breakfast. Very tasteful. The only small issue is that we only got 1 key card for the room while we have 2 adults and 2 children to stay in the hotel. A little bit inconvenience...

I stayed in this Hotel for 3 days. I was really enjoy staying in this Hotel especially at night time. I can enjoy the best view of Night scenic of Tokyo and Tokyo Sky Tree view from my room. The Kinshicho metro is very close from the Hotel. Very convenience to move all parts of Tokyo. Shopping area are also very close from the Hotel. Staffs are very friendly and they are very helpful . Breakfast is also nice.

The hotel location is very near to train and subway..also to malls and other restaurants... Hotel staffs are very helpful and accommodating, very polite and kind.. The breakfast buffet were good, so many choices... Our room is very modern, clean and comfortable.... Will be staying again here on our nxt visit.

The hotel was great from the moment of check in, clean and great service from concierge. It's in a great area convenient to the railways (quick 3 minute walk). We were a family of 4 and booked the room with the 4 twin beds and was perfect. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

This hotel is located in close proximity to the train station, the rooms are great and the service was exceptional, family friendly, buffet breakfast had a lot of variety and catered for traditional Japanese cuisine as well as western cuisine

Very well!The location is near the SKY TREE and the subway and JR station,so it is easy fou out to every place of TOYOTO!The room is clean and quiet.The scene is also good.because we line in 14th floor,so it is plenty of the height for seeing city buildings .The service is also good. They have at least two Chinese,so it is easy for our talking.

Don't be mislead by the Tobu Hotel Levant's large stature or fancy lobby. While these outside facing areas certainly do put the hotel's best foot forward, the room was something out of an un-renovated hotel from the 70s. Our family stayed in a room with four separate beds and were cramped into a tiny space, decorated with awful color, old carpeting, and a dingy bathroom. During our travels through Japan, this was by far the worst hotel we stayed at in Tokyo, Kyoto, and Osaka. Simply put, I felt like I was at grandma's house for the weekend. This hotel's saving grace comes in the form of friendly and helpful staff, which were always very attentive and informative to us foreigners. Also, the hotel's location is convenient as it is close to many tasty restaurants, shopping areas, and Kinshicho station. The breakfast buffet was also quite pleasant. That being said, please do something about your rooms! Based on this experience with our room, I would not stay at this hotel again, even if for free.

Been there just a night when traveling to Tokyo. the location is very convenient, not far away from Tokyo Skytree. The service of the staff is very good, room are spacious and the breakfast meal are very satisfied.

The rooms were spacious and clean. The bathroom amenities were very nice. The staff were so nice and friendly. But the receptionists' English were very very poor but they were very nice too. Unfortunately, the breakfast was very very very poor for internationals! They should really improve it! The only thing i could eat was omlette but they always leave it uncooked like Japanese style so i could not eat! To sum up, nice hotel but need some improvements.

We stayed for 3 nights when we arrived in Japan and could not have wished for a better base. Every staff member we encountered was friendly, efficient and helpful. The room was very comfortable and the beds big (we had 2 adults and 2 children). We didn't eat in the restaurant other than breakfast, which was lovely and very well organised, with a good selection of western and Japanese dishes. We visited the bar area and had a snack, which was delicious and well presented. The hotel is well positioned with a station just a short walk away and some small convenience stores close by if you need some provisions for the room. We also had a fantastic view from our room of the Skytree which looked impressive daytime and nighttime. A wonderful stay in Tokyo and hope we can return soon

Most important of all, the room price is quite reasonable in this hotel. My family stayed at this hotel with the room type of standard twin on Saturday(2016/4/9) for one night, and it only costed 15500円 per person.Moreover, I requested two rooms for neighbors. Although staffs replied that they couldn't promise it, just tried to do their best to fulfill customers' requests. Eventually I got neighbor rooms after checking in.Finally, the size of standard twin rooms(28.5 square meters) are a little bigger than averages(26 square meters). The view could be chosen for the skytree when reserving(view of the skytree plan). I didn't reserve for the skytree view, but we still can see the Tokyo tower at last.(city view). The location of the hotel is also quite convenient.(1 hour from the Narita airport and 5 minutes from the Kinsicho station)One improvable point is the breakfast buffet. Although the famous brand rice called Akita komachi is used, cooked rice is too soft(too much water) to enjoy tasting the grain of rice one by one. The sweet shrimp of the misojiru is quite small, and far from the picture on the website. Therefore, squeezing oranges machine is a marvelous idea, because customers can confirm that the juice is 100% made from the oranges in front of them.

location is very convenient. service is good. it's disney neighbor hotel. it will be beter if we can get bigger room. 3 bed room is too small. You can buy everything you want at Kinshichou. I like this place.

This is a great hotel! Very clean and comfortable. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The hotel is near Kinchico train station, so it's very easy to visit other areas. It's also near a great shopping center and good restaurants. No complaints!

The hotel was very close to the train station. Had a free bus to Disney Land . Had pickup to airport. Couple of good shopping centres near by. We had a great view of the skytree. My family loved this hotel , the staff are great. We took a taxi out the front to great Temple , tourist spot. Only 10min 's away. We walked to the skytree from the hotel , Great shopping there.

We've been waiting for our trip to Japan to begin for weeks, and this was the perfect hotel to start our holiday with, especially after getting off the plane that had been flying for a really long time. Hotel excellent, room amazing, views outstanding and staff very friendly! Would totally recommend this to anyone!!

We recently stayed at the Tobu Levant during a family vacation. Rooms for 4 people are challenging to find in Japan and we picked the Tobu Levant because it had a family room and was well-rated. We were very happy we did. The room was spotless, the staff was friendly and helpful and we had a lovely view of the Skytree Tower. All the beds were real singles, no cots, and we had enough room (especially for Japan where rooms can be small). There is free wifi and the breakfast was good - lots of Western and Japanese choices. The location was very convenient - right next to a station with both a Metro line and JR line (Kinshisho Station) so we were easily able to explore Tokyo and also use our JR passes for day trips. One tip - by a Suica card for the Metro. You can buy it from the JR machine at the station and load it with whatever amount you need. It can be used for all the Metro lines in Tokyo and we also used it in Osaka and for some vending machines. It is very convenient and saves a lot of time when you are traveling around.

I was in Tokyo for a business trip on the weekend. This hotel which was right next to a shopping centre, close to cafés and shops. I stayed in a room with a beautiful view of the Skytree Tower. Amenities were thoughtful.Note: there is wifi internet offered, so this updates some comments about no free wifi. Also there is smoking allowed in rooms. So, check with reception if there are non-smoking rooms available.Arigato!

Very professional staff and extremely helpful concierge who thankfully spoke English for us bumbling Australian's! Excellent location to the trains, shops and restaurants & bus to Disneyland was perfect!

We have a nice family time and we spent the last night here. The location of this Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo is good and the breakfast is delicious. Thanks for your service, and every clerk is always smiling and patient.

The hotel is awesome. It's not small for even 3 ppl. Pretty close to JR station. It take around 5 mins by walk. In the south exit of Kinshichō station, there are so many stores. You can spend a lot of time there.

This trip was part business with a couple of days added for leisure before & after. The hotel was easy to get to and from Haneda airport since it's on one of the airport bus routes. The staff was very helpful arriving, departing and during our stay, I noticed at one of the other hotel stops people were on their own standing outside waiting for the bus. The Tobu staff took our luggage and asked us to sit inside and they came and got everyone for the bus.The breakfast buffet has something for everyone and worth the price but if you get it included it's probably a little cheaper, other breakfast options are coffee shops in the shopping center at the train station. Not well advertised is there's a convenience store right outside the 2nd floor doors to the right and a Tulleys coffee shop to the left, also 2 convenience stores right accross the street. The meals served at the 2nd floor are all buffet style and the Skytree view restaurant/bar are set menus from what I can tell, the only ala carte menu is the coffee shop on the 1st floor but there are loads of places near the hotel.The Kinshicho train station is nearby and a lot of stores and restaurants are in that complex, Skytree up the street about 1km walk but we took a taxi for about $7 but i'm old and lazy. Plenty of taxi's if your late for a meeting..... & the hotel will get one for you. I noticed they provide a free Disney shuttle bus also which is great if that's where you're headed and i'm keeping that in mind for the future. They also had other tours through a bus company but you need to book in advance unless you like riding the train and walking alot, hey some people do for the adventure.The room and amenities were good and the price was resonable, we booked direct thru the hotel website online since this trip was a last minute thing. The website in English is a little off but you get the idea, I emailed them a question and got a prompt answer. (If they need help with that english website I can help) lol. We couldn't get the in room wifi to work and there was a notice in the room that no tech support is available but since we have local phones it wasn't an issue for us, didn't use the wired connection.Overall the Tobu Levant is a pretty good hotel considering price, accessibility and services provided, we'll be staying here again.

We booked a two-night stay at the Hotel though Trivago and thought it good value for money as a mid-range priced Hotel. Good location for all amenities. Railway station very close and plenty of taxis to hand. Found all the staff very helpful and courteous. Would stay there again.

Hotel was close to train station & easy to get around. Quiet location. Room was clean & tidy, roomier for four people than other hotels stayed at. Room had climate control. No self service laundry, but they do have a washing service but that's expensive. Bus service to & from airport was handy. Free shuttle to Disneyland. Buffet breakfast caters well to both Japanese & Western food.

Location of the hotel next to the subway stations, shopping malls and a wide choice of restaurants. Rooms are not very spacious as expected in the city center. "Good Neighbor Hotel" of Tokyo Disney Resort with shuttle service between the theme park and the hotel.

We had a nice size room with a beautiful view of the city! The hotel is walking distance to the Tokyo SkyTree and the JR station. The included breakfast is excellent with lots of great choices. The staff are very curious and accommodating. Would definitely recommend!P.S. Check out "Zanmai Sushi" 10 minutes walking distances from the hotel. We ate there twice and the sushi was incredible!

Hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. They don't speak too much English, but can still find a way to help you out. The location is perfect since it is only a 3 miute walk to the Kinshicho Station. We would definitely stay there again.

Check in & check out was a breeze. No fuss. Room was ready and superbly clean when we arrived. The daily room service is superb. We came back to a superbly clean room in the evening after our outing in Tokyo.This hotel is within 5 mins walking distance from Kinshico train station.Tokyo Skytree is within 20 minutes leisure stroll from the hotel. Oh you can see it from the hotel as soon as you come out of the hotel. Walking distance is10 mins if you are in good physical shape.If you are a Muslim traveller you'll find Sekai Cafe on the way to Tokyo Skytree. Its Halal and the food is nice.Lots of family mart and shopping places around the hotel too.

The rooms are a little room for a 4star hotel but you could expect that in a city like Tokyo... The Staff is courteous ... The Breakfast spread is elaborate with Japanese and other items ... Priced decently for the kind of services you get ... Tokyo Skytree is in walking distance ... Loads of eating places around to suit everyone's palate ...

Great friendly large hotel. We were giving a upgrade on our honeymoon and had fantastic views over Kinshicho towards the Tokyo skytree.Room was a ok size, rooms are always smaller in Tokyo. But it was very clean, tidy and comfortable.Worth a visit to the restaurant on the top floor for a few drinks. Expensive but great views and brilliant staff.Would stay here again next time in japan.

Enjoyed our stay at Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo, with friendly and helpful staff. We managed to book a family room for 4 pax. Price paid was reasonable, considering it's the holiday season. Walking distance to Tokyo Skytree and plenty of eateries around. Recommended.

Good rooms! I would come back.if I come to Tokyo next time. Every months I must to go to Japan last time I can choice.because I like this hotel is Hotel near the train I can go anywhere I can do anything

Loved this location, easy access to Tokyo Station and walking distance to Asakusa and Tokyo Skytree. JR train station right next door and plenty of supermarkets to buy essentials. Staff at hotel were also very friendly and helpful.

Enjoyed our stay at the Tobu. Rooms were clean, large, and had no problem getting WiFi in the rooms. Had breakfast at the buffet and it was awesome with American, Japanese and Chinese food. Hotel is also connected to a mall with great shops. Just a few blocks from the subway station which was nice too.

Good location,near sky tree and subway. And there is shuttle bus to disney land. But only few hotel stuff can speak english.Have some problem when I try to make a reservation for shuttle bus. Concierge stuff is very friendly and helpful.

Nice hotel located at quiet neighborhood. Good location near a JR train station and Metro subway station. Peikko (Moomin shop) is just 3 minutes walk from the hotel. Next door shopping building has a book shop, restaurants, Daiso (100 Yen shop), a big shop that supply baby and infant stuffs, Uniglo, GU and many more shops. A departmental store and electrical store (Yodobashi) are located at the other side (south exit) of the train station. Akihabara station is just 2 train station away. Skytree is only 1 subway station away.

Its location is very good, very near walking distance to Tokyo Tree tower and main railway station. Having next building food court with all type of restaurants and variety of food.The grocery stores are also in front of the hotel.Wifi is available in lobby as well in rooms.Having good lobby with a coffee shop.

I really enjoy staying at the Tobu when I visit Tokyo.The staff is very nice and can speak English well. They also have most things written in English. I usually eat breakfast there. They have a large buffet with Western and Japanese food on it so finding something was not a problem. Nice rooms (for the small size) and a wonderful view if you are on the side of Skytree.

Clean and friendly staffs. Good location if you plan to visit Disney land, Tokyo Sky tree and Asakusa at the same time. Easy accessible from and to the airports (Narita or Haneda) with the limousine bus service. Kinshicho station just a walk away.

A business contact booked me the hotel, otherwise I would never have considered staying in Sumida and would have continued to stay in the touristy areas like Shinjuku!I don’t think I have ever slept so well and stayed in such a quiet hotel with no traffic noise! It was wonderful.The only negative (which has been well documented in other reviews) is the lack of casual seating in the foyer. There is seating available at certain hours but is intended for bar guests. It would have been perfect to meet business colleagues in the foyer instead of having to walk to a nearby coffee shop.The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the Kinshicho JR station. In fact, when it is raining, you only have to walk outside for a short distance and can cut through the shopping mall! It is then 3 stops to Tokyo station. There is also a local metro stop about 5 mins walk away.Tips: When you book, request a room: • Facing the Skytree.• High up• On a non-smoking floor (if you don’t smoke)Upon check in, ask to borrow a router. The internet connection is unreliable and frustrating. Far better to borrow a router at the start of your stay and have a reliable service. They also lend electricity adaptors for people like me who forget to bring them!If you are going to need a guidebook in a foreign language, then you must bring it with you (or take the train to a tourist information office elsewhere in the city.) Sumida is not the sort of area where you can purchase postcards or foreign newspapers. It is where Japanese people work and live. It is safe and very refreshing!Some of the hotel staff speak good English and try very hard to help but they were only able to provide a train/metro map in English. If you are going to be exploring, then consider buying a JR rail pass before you arrive in Japan for the best deal. I decided that as I would get lost countless times, I would purchase a combo 1 day ticket which covered the Metro & JR within Tokyo. It cost approx. 1500 yen and was worth it. Otherwise, you have to buy a ticket from the machines at each station which is confusing. The reception staff at the Tobu wrote a note in Japanese explaining what I wanted to purchase and I handed the railway ticket office clerk the same note each day! It was perfect.If you want to eat out, there are countless small restaurants in the nearby shopping mall for lunch. Otherwise, we ate at the Terzo3 Italian restaurant which is very close to the hotel and which we could see from the room. The food was excellent and the staff very welcoming.I was REALLY impressed and will certainly stay there again next time I am in Tokyo.

Visited Tokyo with my three children between 18 and 22 in July 2015.We got a room with four very comfy beds on the 21st floor with amazing view over the Skytree. Very clean room and bathroom. We booked six months in advance and got a great price for this high standard hotel. Great shopping and a variety of restaurants around the corner as well as subway and trains.Would give five stars if the hotel would have a nice seating area in the lobby and the breakfast not so expensive. We only got two room keys and sometimes had to wait for each other to come home and it would have been nice with a sofa in the lobby! We got a 50 percent discount on breakfast for one day and it was definitely worth 1000 yens but not full price of 2000.On the whole we will strongly recommend this hotel!

We booked this place for 4 night for our family of 4. My kids are seniors in school and collage. They had 4 beds for us and we loved the atmosphere and the Traditional Japanese hospitality. The front desk people helped us to plan our day trip, advised us about the local transits and place to eat etc.Although it is bit expensive, I would recommend this hotel to any one.It was also closer to Subway and JR trains which makes it very easy to move around.I will definitely come back to the same hotel.Good jobs guys.

I booked 4 nights at this hotel to accommodate me for a short visit to Tokyo. The property is very good, not luxurious but very decent, and at a very good location just 3 minutes walk to a train station. The neighbourhood is fairly OK, I noticed some "red light" kind of activities t the south side, but it's fine without issues.I was given a non-smoking room at the 19th floor, but unfortunately not with a view at the Tokyo SkyTree. I don't blame them of course, I had asked but wasn't available at the time. The room was small, which I presume is pretty much the standard for Tokyo, but functional and clean. There were two single beds, indicating it was also used to host couples. For one person it was just fine, but a couple would suffer, so in that case make sure to check the room size.Breakfast was very good with quite some choices of either western or Japanese flavour. The bar at the top floor is also very nice in the evening with stunning Tokyo SkyTree views. I didn't try the restaurant however. The staff is very attentive at all posts, exhibiting the famous natural politeness of Japanese people.Internet access was not very stable, sometimes the wifi it was not connecting at all. There's some room for improvement here.All in all, a very good choice for a Tokyo visit, well served by public transportation, with excellent staff. Certainly a choice!

One of the important things needed these days is Wifi access. Especially if you're not from the Country of Japan. While they have access to one for their guests, it's extremely spotty at best. The room is a bit small, and the ceilings are very low especially in the bathroom. If you're in need of a gym, one doesn't exist here as well. The hotel is however close to the Metro train stations, and has a beautiful bar on the top floor with spectacular views! Also, transportation was east here via the Limousine bus. Overall good place. Relatively decent price, but missing some key components.

Everything is good for the hotel except there is no wireless network in the room. The wireless network is only avalailable in the lobby. I choose this hotel because it provide airport transfer and also the bus transportation to Disneyland and sea. is recommended if you are going with family with kids.

The Tobu is situated in a central location and easy walk to shopping or trains. There is really no area to meet in the lobby just to sit and talk. The section in the center where there are tables and chairs appears closed most of the time; however, I have seen it open for breakfast snacks and for lunch, but you need to buy something; you cannot just sit and socialize as you can in most hotels with a 4 star rating. Rooms are small and clean but quite expensive, The one we had had a queen sized bed but, if you were sitting at the desk and someone needed to pass, they had to crawl over the bed to accomplish this. We had vouchers for the breakfasts which had a variety of Japanese items. The 24th floor is the restaurant/bar and has a magnificent view of the Tokyo skyline including the Skytree Tower. Well worth a visit though pricey! Also, if you want late check-out or early check-in that can be a considerable cost. Be sure to ask up front!

I stay at this hotel about once a year. The staff is typical Japanese service, which is always excellent. The breakfast buffet is excellent, with some western and some eastern items. It is always nice, stocked and clean.The rooms are small, but they make you feel comfortable. They are modern and clean. Ask for a room facing the Skytree; the view is incredible. Get as high of a room in the hotel as you can. Also, if you want Internet, you need to ask for it from the front desk. They gave me a personal wireless device, which I could connect my laptop and mobile phone to. Internet is pretty fast.Taxis are easy to get, and the train station is close. To get from Narita, take the T-CAT bus and take a taxi from T-CAT to the hotel, do in reverse to get back to Narita. The bus ride can be about 45 minutes. Taxis are easy to get in front of the hotel.There is a lot of shopping and food in the area. I felt safe at all hours when walking around.There is a great bar/eating on the top floor. They charge each person in the party for the view of the city along with your meal/drinks; I think the view is worth it.

review_body: I stayed at Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo on 2008, but this hotel is so amazing that I couldn't resist the urge to still write my review! Kinshichō is a lovely neighborhood I fell in love with. You'll have a good metro lines for exploring Tokyo just few minutes away from the hotel! And I can tell you the views this hotel has especially during the night are FANTASTIC!

with sky tree view,near with JR and Metro station,this place was very great for familythe restaurant for breakfast was nicethe staff is very nice to their customerthe room is cleanand the best part for me,as first time in tokyo,this hotel near with some convenient stores,supermarket,and fashion boutique like uniqlo,and i can sleep very well,because the room is very very great with the internet connection too.and u can borrow the router from front desk.and me as a muslim can buy some halal food in the store in front of the hotel.
another way to enjoy the skytree,viewing from the window of the light up version.amazing!and the room was big enough and had a sound sleep here.The food was also delicious.

The best part of this hotel was availability of wi-fi and the proximity to station, in addition to wonderful spread of breakfast and a nice sleep + shower. I would recommend this hotel for anybody who intends to stay in this region. The only suggestion is to have a swimming pool and gym.

When I first started traveling to Japan I stayed here 4 times a year some lengthy some short. I am an ex smoker so the smell of smoke makes me physically sick. the hotels a/c system still had stale remnants of its past smoking days. Other than that, it is well located to Kinshicho station, got a market, shopping mall right next door and tons of excellent eateries from Burger King, Yoshino ya, Akino Zen, Spainada and sushi galore. Theres even a 24 hour ramen shop right across the street.

I stayed in Tobu Levant during our trip in 2009, 2012 and 2013. My family and I loved how comfortable (and affordable) the rooms are. It might not be that luxurious but we still appreciate the comfort it gave us after long walks around Tokyo. The staff are friendly and can speak english. They also have a free shuttle to Tokyo Disney Resort that will save you from the pain of commuting to Chiba and rushing so you'd arrive there early. There's also a mall that's only a 3-minute walk away from the hotel, which is nice because we got to buy groceries and Japan goodies that we took home. Also, there's a restaurant just right outside the hotel that's very affordable, and a 7-11 too for quick midnight snacks. We'll definitely book here again on our next trip to Tokyo.

This hotel is smallish in feel with tiny rooms but if you're in the 50% of guests on the Sky Tree side of the hotel you're virtually guaranteed a good view of the Sky Tree just 0.9 miles away. If you have the money, go for either the Corner Twin or, better yet, the Deluxe Twin. Both will have wide double windows and the best views of the Sky Tree. The price will be either 50% more (corner twin) or double (deluxe twin) the price of a standard twin but your experience will be transformed from mundane to ethereal.Be sure your room faces the ST rather than the train station.Dinner at the top 24F restaurant Ren is a great choice. Lunchtime, the place looks a bit drab and feels boring absent the enchanted mood the place takes on early evening, or better yet, later when the Sky Tree is enshrouded in darkness, standing out like an enchanted tower in the distance. So dinner is my recommendation. But be sure to reserve a booth table facing the Sky Tree. The counter is less comfortable though with an equal view, and the tables up on the deck make it difficult to peer out at the view. To reserve, the best idea is to go up to the restaurant ahead of time, either lunch or before dinner, and ask the staff to save you one of the 4 or 5 booths with a good view. Staff is very accommodating and anxious to get the big hitters at night (which they anticipate u are if you're taking the trouble to reserve, but don't feel pressured to order something expensive from the mediocre wine list, as the staff is very polite).The 0.9mile 15 minute walk to the Sky Tree is rather boring, passing through a nondescript neighborhood which could almost be east LA w/o the graffiti. The walk in the summer could have you work up a good sweat so be prepared.You probably want to take the hotel up on its Sky Tree special passes so u can skip the long lines, but those are pricey. Hey, if you stay in the Deluxe or Corner Twin and plan to see the Tree, u may as well complete your premium package.This hotel was formerly a Marriott but Tobu took the hotel back as the Sky Tree was coming up. It is disappointing that there really is no better quality hotel in the Sky Tree area at this moment (eg, no room service or pool/exercise facilities), but I suppose the Mandarin Oriental in Nihonbashi offers a fabulous view of the tower from some of its rooms and restaurants facing east with the ST about a 15-minute cab ride away (10 minutes on a Sunday morning). Service and efficiency at the Tokyo Mandarin can be severely lacking at times though and so I avoid that overpriced office bldg-based complex.

The close location to Kinshicho Station is an advantageous point. As well as Tokyo Sky Tree, the distance to Kokugikan makes me happy during the sumo tournament if I can get a ticket. People are so friendly, and cuisines are excellent, and they can beat even the top class hotels in Tokyo such as Okura, New Otani, and Park Hyatt.

My trip to Tokyo was unfortunately brief, but this hotel helped make it a pleasant and successful trip. The staff was courteous and efficient. I checked in late at night after a long flight and the staff quickly got me checked in and into my room.The room, by my standards was compact, but certainly livable. It was clean and comfortable. One particular thing I liked about the room was the access to power - I travel with a lot of tech and need power. I've been in too many hotels that do a great job of hiding the sockets and making sure they're far away from where you need them.I do also have to add that the bathtub plumbing was completely incomprehensible to me - quite possibly this was a personal deficiency.A complementary breakfast was included, but I did not have time to take advantage of it, so I can't talk about the food there.I was on a high floor on the train station side - others have complained about the noise, but I had no problems with it. I suspect once above the first few floors you'll be ok. The other complaint was the smell. Like in many hotels in Europe and older hotels in the US, the non-smoking floors were converted which tends to leave a rather stale odor. I definitely noticed it here, but at least to me, it wasn't unbearable.They also seem to have some affiliation with Disney, so roving bands of Disney fans were seen roaming the lobby. If you're going to the DIsney park, this would be a plus.All in all, I was happy with the hotel, and will probably stay there again when I'm doing business in the area.

The staff was so friendly, respectful and willing to serve. The hotel is very beautiful. I didnʻt like that there was a smoky air inside, but many places in Japan felt like that. Luckily, we got a non-smoking floor. The view of the Skytree Tower was GREAT from my room. The buffet dinner and breakfast was OVER THE TOP!!! There were so many different foods to choose from. Just about everything that I ate was DELICIOUS. I just wish I had more room in my stomach! =) I liked that it was right next door to the 100 YEN store.

This hotel is located directly at the railway. If you have a room at this side of the hotelyou feel like sleeping on a park bench at the station. Room was old fashioned and stiny (smoker room even none-smoker was booked). For this quality of hotel you will get much better one in Toyko for same price. The only positive thing is the breakfast which was good (for japanese standards) and the entrance hall, where you are welcomed anytime by the page boy.Service at front desk was not very friendly.Opposite to the other reviews i would not recommend to stay in this hotel if you don't book the higher room classes at the right side of the hotel.

We were a jet lagged group arriving by bus, and the staff at the Tobu Hotel Levant in Tokyo welcomed us with warmth and courtesy, offering us bottles of water as we got off the bus. We felt very well cared for. Any time one of us was seen wandering around looking a little lost, some one was there immediately to assist us. The location is great, near a bus and the Kinshicho train station and next to a mall with a food court, making it easy for even our diverse group to find food to make everyone happy. We could hear the trains during the day and early evening, but they seemed to stop at a reasonable hour and didn't interfere with sleep. I appreciated the deep bath tub after our 13 hour plane ride, and choice of pillows. The mattress was a bit firm for me, but my husband liked it. Kimonos and slippers were waiting for us in our rooms. Across the street is a view of the Sky Tower, and down a block what looks like a Shinto shrine, a little of old and new Japan. The breakfast buffet offers both Western and Asian breakfast choices. I tried a little of each type, and found all the choices to be good. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Most hotels in Tokyo offer tiny rooms but this hotel has the largest rooms in Tokyo, plus great views of the Sky Tower. It comes with a breakfast buffet that features designer omlettes, a wide variety of Japanese and Western food, and great coffee. The KIT shopping mall is only a few feet away, and there is also a train station. The beds are very large and comfortable and the shower supplies are top quality.

When staying in Tokyo for a few nights, the Tobu Hotel Levant is a great choice. While I was there for business, my wife was able to take advantage of the nice shops and a choice of restaurants near the hotel. I really liked convenience of the train station as it was just a couple of minutes away - you can be anywhere in Tokyo in just 20-30 minutes. Our room was clean, and even had a view of Mount Fuji. Compared to other higher priced hotels in the city, Tobu Hotel Levant won't disappoint.
